title: A short relaxed stay at O2 Hotel.
text:
1. O2 Hotel has been our pit stop from many years when ever we visit Kolkata.
2. The hotel is near to Airport and very convenient for international travellers who plan to visit Kolkata.
3. Anybody wish to have a Pick-up and Drop to airport, the hotel can provide.
4. As usual we did check-in Premium Suite and i just the same for all international travellers.
5. The check-in process is smooth as usual. There is a good choice of variety at buffet breakfast. The food tastes good.
6. Lunch and dinner could be better. Not sure why dishes are too spicy and oily 
7. The tables, cutlery and other utensils are clean.
8. Compare to the pervious years, The in room service became too expensive than ever. Don’t really see the worth in spending 200% more on some times which comes at the same quality in other hotels.
9. Overall experience is good and I surely recommend O2.

title: Ok for a short stay
text:
Well I booked it because it was rated as 4* on expedia, rooms were cheap(2 nights stay was cheaper than one night stay in Novotel) and was nearer to the airport. Room was OK for a 6-7 hr stay, I wouldn't want to stay there for more than that. The bathroom smelt of urine when I entered, maybe because of the stale air. 

They charged me ~ INR 450 for an airport drop, which they had mentioned they will charge, but considering I was staying only for 6-7 hrs they could have waived it. Hotel is just by the side of the main road so not much to look out of the windows, have to keep the blinds on for privacy

title: good stopover between the flights
text:
Close to the airport, just enough for an overnight stay.
The room small due to 2 extra beds, but our beds were very comfy. There is a big bathroom with perfect shower. 

On our arrival, the staff did not managed our pickup, maybe due to missing Indian phone number.
I had to prove that I had booked 2 extra beds for kids and argue with the staff to bring them to the room.
The staff tried to be welcoming, but for the mentioned misunderstandings / issues I'm not satisfied with their attitude.
On our early arrival next day, we got just some sandwiches and tea/coffee for breakfast.
There is no restaurant close to the hotel, but within 15 min walk you can find an Indian fast food and a Domino's pizza.

title: Adequately welcoming, neat and clean
text:
I had booked 9 rooms for 2 nights (28-29 Jan 2019) with different configurations for the guests arriving from outside Kolkata for my sister's wedding. 

The reception staffs were helpful in arranging the room locations and were ready to make arrangements for the smooth proceeding of the wedding rituals. They also helped in arranging for some vehicles going to the event location and also to the airport. 

The support staffs were extremely helpful and took great care of the guests. 

The guests were happy with the cleanliness of the rooms. 

Although a bit on the pricey side, the staff hospitality, and helpfulness covered for the price paid for the hotel. 

The lift accommodates only 2-3 persons at a time and not convenient for people with claustrophobic tendencies.

The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained, with all the necessary amenities provided. Housekeeping did an excellent job of ensuring everything was spotless and comfortable.

title: Great Hotel, Amazing staff
text: Golden Parkk Hotel is perfect for a Westerner that wants excellent customer service, toilet paper, free water (pani in Bengali), and a large room to call home for how ever long your stay. I was in Kolkata for three weeks and only lasted four nights in a hostel here…they are rough! Golden Parkk Hotel is very clean and doesn’t cost a fortune! I paid $52 USD per night and it was worth every dollar! If you want a good nights sleep, ask to not be located on the 4th floor…there is a nightclub on that floor and you can hear the bass thumping all night long. But don’t that deter from staying here! All the staff are so kind and work hard to make you feel welcome every evening when you come back to rest! There is a small sofa, large writing desk, and free WiFi so you can spread out of staying for a while like I did. The Maidan Metro Station is only an easy three minute walk…this stop is basically the middle of the North/South subway line and gives you easy access to wherever you want to go. Park Street is only a 15 minute walk and the Victorian Memorial is another 15. I had a great experience staying here and recommend it with 6 STARS IF I COULD!
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Good hotel centrally located.
text: A very good hotel... Centrally located. Very friendly and cooperative staff. If you are a party guy then there are so many clubs which can entertain you. The beds are very comfortable and cosy. Check in is hassle free. I want to give 10 out of 10 to front desk people and supporting staff.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Complete AVOID
text:
The main reason for using this hotel is visa interviews with US and British visa offices.

This is a horrible hotel - it has multiple night clubs within the building with ZERO sound proofing. 

The entire building faces sound vibrations from 9.30 pm to 3.30 am when the clubs have music at full blast. You will not be able to sleep in any room.

Do NOT book room in this hotel - there are other options nearby for use during your visa interviews.

If you still need to stay here- the food is decent but the bathrooms are old/ not maintained properly. 
AVOID!
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Great Location
text: Location is excellent. In house dining is fine. I slept well as I was in 3rd floor room. Connectivity is also good. There are many eateries near by. Stayed for just one night. title: Glorious but somewhat missing
text: I still having those Golden moments spent at this wonderful place but still somewhat there staff make us feel like helpless rather it's one of best place of the place whether we talk about services or atmosphere
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Terrible
text:
The first impression was not as good as expected. I asked for a twin room and during check-in reminded them of the same but they gave the wrong room which was later on changed. Within 1/2 hr of check-in ordered food which was worst them small roadside stalls. Since there was no iron in the room I asked the receptionist if he can get my shirt ironed but got an excuse saying i'll only get it the next day in the evening which is impossible.
Showing good gesture he offered me iron from the hotel but when i started ironing my shirt it spoiled it with black marks. 
When it comes to bed they were very uncomfortable and linen was smelly.
The next day i had to go out for few hours leaving my mom in the room. I passed by the reception and asked the boy if he can send something light to my room as my mom is not feeling well and she won't be able to come down for breakfast, he said its buffet but when i told him anyway m not having breakfast so you can send something light to the room, He gave positive response and said once breakfast is ready he ll do that but nothing happened till i came back around 3 Pm.
Won't be booking any OYO from now.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Good location.  But poor facilities
text: The location of the hotel is too good and is very near to park Street with a big mall just  in front of it. Room service is very average. Hotel is neat. But some construction work is being carried out and they start the work around 5 am and you cannot have a good sleep. Complimentary breakfast  is not  upto the mark and you do not have any varieties. The only advantage is the location.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Worst hotel in Kolkatta
text:
This is my one of the worst experience of staying in a hotel. The rooms are very basic and no basic facility available in room except a bed. There is heavy condensation in all the rooms and water is dripping right from the check in counter & in rooms. This place does not have any converters for your lap top or any electric appliances and /or the power points did not conform to standards (you can not charge your apple laptop). No basic stationary in room.
No restaurant in hotel, and the food is served in room and you have to eat the same on your bed. NO plates & cutlery is provided for eating food only after multiple reminder the same is sent.
The breakfast served is cold and the burners were not working.When i inquired for the same i was informed that they do not have chemical /oil and the same is exhausted and they could not source the same during my 3 day stay.
the quality of linen was very bed ,one gets a better quality even in a guest house.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: The most horrific night
text: I was visiting Kolkata for a conference and had booked Oyo Town House for a couple of nights. I checked in around 8:30 pm and went to sleep by 10ish, woke up at 11:30 pm to a nightmare, my arms had rashes and so did my face and leg, I realised it was something to do with the bed, called Reception, no one showed up for 15 minutes, later they sent a boy to change the bedsheet. I asked for the manager but there was none, called Oyo SOS, they said they would call a doctor which never arrived. In the midst of me losing my mind, they calling a doctor , the house keeping removed the bedsheet to realise the linens were dirty, the mattress topper had dust, hair, small tiny black things and so was the case with the inside of the duvet cover. It was the must disgusting sight, I asked them to move me to another hotel and they had to audacity to tell me contact Oyo, this is 1:30 am, no doctor, no fresh room and no manager onsite. The GM was on the phone with me and confessed that a doctor was never on his way and the staff had been manipulating me all this while. I spoke to my doctor, got meds and was moved to another room at 3:00 am in the morning. Nobody has bothered to take any action or update me. I was moved to another room only because I had call cops to my rescue.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Pathetic room: all water in the room
text:
We checked-in at 5pm on 8th Sept. And it was all mist in the room. By night, it was all water on the floor, doors, windows, mirror and on the ceiling. We asked reception and then he said it's because the window was open. The whole night the window was closed, and the next morning it felt like we were in some sort of an aquarium. Water was dropping down from the ceiling on us... Our bags, our clothes, etc all had become wet. It was a disgusting sight.
Hopeless staff and uncooperative.  
Said he could not help us in any way
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Decent hotel
text: I had a decent time here. But my booking experience with oyo was poor. The call center guy lied to me and got me book meals at the hotel when the hotel (at that time) did not even have a kitchen. And it was so tough to get it modified after that. Repeated calls from hotel staff and I went unanswered at the oyo backoffices.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: OYO Converted a 4 Star Hotel to 2 Star Hotel
text:
The Rooms are Good but the OYO Management in its lust to create its Brand Style for Townhouse Category of Hotels (owned/leased and managed by OYO Team) has converted once upon a time 4 Star Hotel to a 2 Star Hotel. Till the OYO Management operates this Hotel at its peak level with introduction of 2 - 3 Restaurants, a Live Pub etc; I do not see any big upgrade.

Advantage - Location and Price at which you may get the Room. So have the Room and enjoy as it can be utilised by Unmarried Couples (local Id accepted), Family, Married Couples as well as Business People.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Good location poor service
text: I booked this hotel coz it is nearer to Victoria memorials. Their servicing is so poor, like room keeping. Rooms are well maintained, cleaned and washrooms are hygeined. I also order breakfast which was not so good.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Good location, poor service
text: The hotel is conveniently located and is a similar concept to the Travelodge in the UK. The rooms are a good size, basic/minimalist and could do with improvements in hygiene. Perhaps an armchair or two in the rooms can make it more appealing. The front desk almost cancelled our booking despite confirming it and blamed it on the air conditioning not working rather than them doing a blunder with overbooking. There was no hot water - had to call the front desk more than 3 times for it. The staff could do with better training in housekeeping and general upkeep of the property. All in all, at a hotel priced like this, they can at least get the basics right, i.e clean rooms and bathrooms, crisp bedding and towels, hot water and quality breakfast.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Not worth it - Don't stay here
text:
The property promises an air conditioned clean room with breakfast, hot water, WiFi and other services. 

Their service is pathetic. Hygiene levels are poor and they just don't clean the rooms and bathrooms well. The floors are sticky for some reason. There's no hot water to bathe until you call them up multiple times at the reception. Breakfast is unhygienic. Service is bad. Pathetic experience in this lovely city. We're a couple touring Calcutta and stayed here for 5 nights. There is no shelf to put the suitcase on. It's just a pathetic experience all together. They don't clean the rooms even after informing. Not worth at all. Suggest to never stay here. You're better off paying little extra and staying somewhere else.

Pros
Good location.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Worst Nightmare
text: No room service, no restaurant as advertised,the room door keys are not working, quality of food will make you puke, guys in the reception/staff are uncooperative, speaking to the OYO property manager Vikramjeet Singh is of no help. My mistake I have paid for my stay in advance or would have never gone through this nightmare. Please do not go for this place at all.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Shudnt have been opened without all amenties
text: Very good location.. Very well made, just opened 7 days ago.. BUT, No restaurant.. Staff, service level Not Upto mark.. Took me 1 hour for checkin.. Oyo people, bugged me by calling 4 times in half an hour.. Very bad and cold and inadequete, breakfast provided.. Not providing all thats given in the oyo app.. In coming days, this shall become the best oyo property in Kolkata, but till then better to avoid.. Oyo shudnt have opened this property without all Functionality.. Disappointed, but yes hoping for a bright future to this proerty.. This is no doubt a brilliant makeover by OYO.. Breakfast, pic given below..
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: good location and good atmosphere
text: Good location, nearby everywhere. and all other important locations. Nice and clean rooms, and nice room services, however few facilities should to be improved. Delicious food and overall value of money.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: A splendid surprise!!!!
text:
I had a 2 night 2 day stay in this hotel. The room in which i stayed was very comfortable and cozy. however since i was on the 1st floor, i hardly got a good view of the landscape outside. There were only a few staff when i checked in (probably because I checked in a bit late) and there was no one to escort me to my room and I had to search for my room on my own.
The buffet breakfast was pretty good. the spread was decent.
A shopping complex is located just opposite to this hotel which is fun to check out. There are a lot of areas of interest nearby.
The hotel has a nice night club though i did not spend much time there.

Overall a good choice for a person who wants to live in the heart of the city and enjoy the night club in the hotel.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Scarce parking, no proper smoking area, lovely food, avg meeting room
text:
The best way to reach the place is to take a taxi from Exide crossing. We had been here in a business meeting for 2 days. The Picadilly 5 room was spacious but it had many issues like:-
1. AC not working frequently
2. Light intensity was very low
3. Chairs were very uncomfortable: not revolving type, no feet / headrest, small sized and heavy.
I did not like the concept of allowing public smoking within the main entrance gate and the reception entry point. Since the premises is not big, Smoking zones should be provided either at backside or prohibited within the premises so that non-smokers do not feel annoyed while walking into the hotel.
We were offered lunch and refreshments. Taste, menu, quality, quantity, hospitality etc were all very good and prompt. Utensils were clean but the napkins were very old and torn at many places. Another strange point: Forks were served only after being asked for. 
Parking for personal cars was a challenge for us as there are very few (5-7) slots in front of the hotel. Most of the times occupied by yellow board cabs. Not sure if they have underground parking for visitors or boarders.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Centrally Located: Value for Money
text: Good hotel for an average budget. No extravaganza/frills yet neat and clean courteous staff and excellent location steal the show.  London Pub in hotel is happening place and crowded in weekends. Complimentary Breakfast choices are good. Spread needs to be in bigger place, understand that their usual place is under renovation. Rooms are spacious and well maintained.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Traditional culture with latest amenities
text: It is a old property in very busy location of Esplanade. Great place for business meetings as may board rooms available. Good excellent. Close to eden gardens, park street and esplanade market. Nice service.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Old Built...Awesome Food
text: Being in one of the happening and posh locality in Kolkata; this hotel seems costly and renovation is the need of the hour. One thing that keeps you happy is the hotel food. Though its costly you enjoy it very much like Aloo Posto; Sukto; Chanar Dal etc are too yummy.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Old hotel with old charm
text: An old hotel with same old interior and old charm. Yes the old look is good but some time we feel that some items in room must be updated as per modern requirements. On the day of check in they provide you one complementary drink. Food is good. Heavy traffic area. No much spaces in or around except the lobby. Stayed there for 3 nights and the place is always full of people due to many functions etc going on.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: It's a hotel that never sleeps
text: Well after browsing through various travel sites the best possible rate for the room was offered my the sales department of the hotel. The rates a bit high but the location, staff and food compensate it all. Other issue I found was the one way timings for vehicles, cab driver have some issues as most of the time they have to travel to take a route according to the one way timings which are not updated in their car apps. The check in was smooth and very fast. the room (twin bed) was cozy with all amenities, wi fi was erratic though. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable but in the odd hours the promptness of the service dwindled, had to call 2-3 times for something basic done. the morning breakfast (complimentary) with room was served in the ground floor Piccadilly hall and was sumptuous and had variety from indian, south indian to continental delicacies, live eggs-to-order counter was fast and served with yummy cheese omlette. over all this is best for business travellers obviously if their trips are sponsored.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: The Indian Institute of Welding AGM
text: We had two days program at this hotel on 23rd and 24th September '16 so made the booking for accommodation for 2 days there only through Trip Adviser. Got a good deal. Reaching there was bit of problem due to one way traffic rule near most roads near the hotel. Got good room. Lunch and dinner were good. Had buffet food during the programs. Complementary breakfast was ok. Could have been better. Checkout was smooth.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Dated decor, malfunctioning lift, poor food
text: Recently had the opportunity to stay in this hotel. As soon as you enter you will feel that  you have travelled to the Kolkata of the 50s of past century. The decor and ambience reeks of nostalgia. If you are trying to use the lift be prepared to be surprised because even after pressing the right buttons it refuses to move. About the food the less said the better. All the meals are uniformly dull insipid and impossible to eat.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: great location and thats just about it
text: I had booked this hotel through their online service. I offered them my credit card so that i can use the room service. They said either I allow them to charge me an advance and then return any money left or i should pay cash. Every time i ordered, the waiter expected a cash payment. When i told him I am happy to pay at the end of my last order instead of every time - he panicked! The bar was being renovated and so was the dining hall. Having breakfast in a closed room was not the best experience! The split AC in the room was struggling - I am guilty of killing a cockroach in the bath! The hotel doesnt even offer free wifi when it is being renovated and charges the normal rate...
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: I always stay in your hotel and fully satisfy from your services and registration process
text: I always stay in your hotel and fully satisfy from your services and registration process , your staff and reception guys are well mannered as well as polite with customers , your service staff and security staff also well mannered .  over all i am fully satisfy and will recommend my friends and colleges.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Clean but dated infrastructure
text:
Stayed in this hotel because of its location which is very near to US consulate.
Clean hotel with very prompt staff service.Though the building is little old with few visible signs of age.But all in all a good place to stay.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Excellent staff
text:
Me and my colleague stayed in Golden Parkk in April. The upholstery looks a bit dated and the breakfast hall needs renovation and easy accessibility for the elderly and disabled. However, all these don't seem to matter once you meet the excellent staff. They really make you feel totally at home. None of the generic service of bigger hotel chains.Here you get individualized attention and service.The Manager even sourced for us lovely fresh Pomfrets and got it packed in ice before our flight. Will definitely come back again.
A big thank you to the entire staff.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Rotary Meeting
text:
We have our bi weekly Rotary Meeting here. We had our meeting yesterday in one of their new banquet halls. The food and service were good.

title: Almost Golden!
text:
Recently on a business trip to Kolkata, I happen to stay at this Hotel Golden Parkk. Here is my feedback.

The Good
- Location: close to the business districts of Kolkata
- Spacious rooms, well furnished
- Clean and hygienic bathroom
- Decent Mattresses and Pillows 
- Food is quite good. Both Breakfast and Lunch were good. I would recommend the freshly made Dosas in the morning. Very well done indeed.
- Their concept of a welcome drink of a Pint of beer or 30ml of liquor was quite interesting and a welcome change from many hotels that over price alcohol.

The Bad:
- Overbearing service. Two times the guy knocked as I was eating my dinner. They need to give space to their clients
- Wi-Fi is pathetic. Got disconnected 10 times atleast.
- Guess the hotel was renovated in phases. It is a labyrinth of up/down/left/right turns in the hotel between meeting rooms and place where they serve lunch. They are maximising their space.
 
The Ugly
- Nothing that I can think of

Overall Verdict: Great place to stay. Go ahead.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Golden service from Golden Parkk
text:
We are regular customers of this hotel. And the hotel takes enough care to see that it stays that way. We have started taking many elements of their excellent service as taken for granted. Conducting one day meeting at another hotel reminded me the quality of service at Golden Parkk.
Everybody, from the bell boys, the servers in the banquet to the head of banquet knows and greets you personally. 
Although many of the halls can do with some renovation, the quality of service makes up for it.
Head of banquet services Mr. Subroto makes it a point to meet you at least once just to make sure that everything is going alright. Even their Director Ms Ramnik also visits if she is in town.
The food is very tasteful and sumptuous. Where most other hotels baulk if you ask for some small favorss like may be a cup of tea or an extra half hour, at Golden Parkk are delighted to oblige you.
The hotel may not be very glamorous or super luxury but their customer oriented service makes the meetings successful.
Only improvement I suggest is that they should investigate why in contrast to the rest of the hotel staff, the front office ladies are almost gruff and quite unfriendly!!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

title: Good hotel, shady restaurant
text:
This hotel is appropriate if you want to stay and conduct business conference in the same place. Their banquets are good and the staff manages it well. The drag is the food that you need to bear with. The lobby and bookings staf looks clueless at times. My booking had come to them 2 times via email and still the night I reached they had not managed to communicate with each other properly. Had to wait 20 mins at 1am for them to confirm that I can get a room.

+'s: room size, popularity, conference rooms, lobby and lift

^'s (areas of improvement): staff communication, restaurant cleanliness and food quality, and yes I saw a cockroach in the restaurant

I hope this review helps my fellow travelers.

title: Average Business Hotel
text:
This is your average business hotel almost in the heart of the city located on Ho Chi Minh Sarani beside Tata Centre.
Only if your work is near Chowringhee/Park street/US Consulate office in the same road,then you have an advantage over other hotel,otherwise it is not worth to stay here.

I actually did not stay here,but attended two back to back programs on two evenings at the banquet hall.Valet service is not good,they are upstart forgetting their salarys are paid through our money!

Nice looking small Reception and lobby once you go inside with glass paneled elevators will surprise you considering this is supposedly a budget business hotel.Overall clean ambiance.

Food is surprisingly good and their Fish batter fry was to die for.But again staff courtesy is not very good.The staff attending the buffet counter have a condescending tone without any apparent reason.

This hotel has a nice mall nearby apart from the proximity to Birla Planetarium,Maidan greens and Victoria Memorial

Overall an average hotel with superlative food but staff attitude is nothing to write home about (Manager should take note to improve)

title: Not really Golden..
text:
Stayed 2 nights here on an official trip. Yes, it's an old hotel with  basic amenities.. I found the room, washroom and the surroundings clean and comfortable. Majority of the guests are business travelers. 
Was indeed surprised to see that most of the staff were not only well trained but spoke pretty decent English. 
The buffet breakfast was not something to rave about in terms of the spread but the taste was decent. 
Was disappointed that the bengali cuisine was not available as their chef happened to be on leave. The continental menu is avoidable and the food that was served by room service had turned completely cold when it reached me. 
Surprisingly, though it's a business hotel they do not keep iron handy. Being a business hotel, such amenities are these days Considered basic and they should be provided. In the absence of an iron, I had requested the laundry dept to get my clothes ironed first thing in the morning as I had to leave for the meetings. However, there was no response to my call to pick the clothes and Noone turned up till even 8.15am. Finally when I was about to leave the bell boy landed up and was insisting that I get the laundry done now. Did mention my disappointment to the front desk to which the reply was a feeble.. 'oh I  am sorry....'  must mention that both during check in and check out felt that the receptionists at the front desk were unnecessarily curt to guests and very mechanical. 
Hence would say it was a so-so experience.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Письмо от хозяина с благодарностью за визит)
text: Несколько раз приходилось останавливаться в этом отеле. Общее впечатление хорошее. Сам отель кажется компактным- здесь же и лобби и ресторан, но работа архитектора и дизайнера оставила очень приятное впечатление. Высокий по потолок в лобби и в ресторане, капсульный прозрачный лифт, деревянные  декорации- все со вкусом. Комнаты обычные, было чисто. Обслуживающий персонал был незаметен(Это плюс). Еда вкусная. Завтрак на должном уровне. Приятно удивило в меню мясо по- строгановски. Клиенты все приличные люди. Место расположения - центр города. Я бы еще остановилась здесь . Один минус - не всегда удачный вид из окна (если не сторона входа). Единственный отель, хозяин которого прислал письмо с благодарностью за наш визит и приглашение посетить отель снова( тогда мы жили в другом городе Индии ). Мелочь, но приятно.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Ok but can be better
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during my official trip in Feb 2014. This hotel is just next to tata steel office and walkable distance from metro station "Maidan" and close to park street. This hotel hold lot of business conferences. Rooms looked clean but I found few hair on bed. Also toilet was not properly clean.
I asked to clean room before I left for dinner. Later I found that toilet was clean but room wasn't. I called housekeeping which took long time to arrive.(Imagine it was 11:30PM and I was sleepy). Housekeeping staff refused to clean bed saying -"I can't do all work". I lost my temper and threaten him to leave hotel. After that he changed my bedsheets. Breakfast was very poor quality. South Indian breakfast was cold and soggy.Sausages looked like their kitchen product. There was no verity in breakfast. on 2nd day I was pleased to see chicken nuggets as an option in breakfast. It ended in disappointment when I tested it. It was left over chicken wings,hard and dark in colour fried in red colour to hide dark colour. It spoiled my taste bud and I left without having anything. Hotel couldn't accept diners card and I had to pay by other card.I gave this feedback to hotel while leaving. Hope they improve but I am not going their again.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Stay Away!
text:
Stayed at the Golden Park Kolkata after a gap of 8 years. Was there for 2 nights in Feb 2014 on a business trip. The booking was done by my company or I would never have opted for this property.

The problems started at check in. I asked for a King size bed, bud was told that they are all occupied. I was given a room with twin beds. Room 302 to be precise. I had checked in around midnight and went almost immediately to sleep. The was a loud hum and a vibration in the room. Thinking it was the airconditioning, I turned off the Ac but the noise continued. After enduring the noise for over 2 hours I finally called the reception. I was told that the noise was due to a generator below the room. Thankfully they agreed to change my room. So finally at 3 am i got another room, where thankfully the noise was much less and could finally sleep.

The Room: The hotel is over 2 decades old, and so are the rooms. Not been refurbished so far. The beds are rock hard as are the pillows. Extremely uncomfortable. to sleep on. The bathrooms too are of the by gone era. Room amenities are satisfatory.

Breakfast: Served in the basement. A bit dark and dingy room. Spread is extremely limited and none too great in taste either. Few tables packed rather closely and always over crowded. 

Lunch and dinner: Also served in the same basement. Limited menu at the buffet and rather awful in taste. Much rather just walk out and eat elsewhere.

Overall ambience: Nothing to speak of. Practically no parking space. Small lobby.
No health club, no swimming pool. There used to be a swimming pool around a decade back, but was filled in and converted into banquet rooms.

Sales Representatives hotel: Well this hotel has something like 14 banquet/conference rooms. Always booked by companies for their sales people. So there are teams of sales people all around.

Location: Not bad. Reasonably close to the business district and Park street.

Service: was the best part of the stay. Service is surprisingly good. 

Price: Really high given the standard of the hotel. I paid Rs 6000/-, that too corporate rate.

Overall a salesmens hotel. Nothing more.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Memorable Family Stay at The Lindsay Hotel, Kolkata! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
text:
Our family trip to Kolkata was truly unforgettable, thanks to the wonderful experience we had at The Lindsay Hotel! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warm smiles and prompt service that made us feel right at home.

You simply can’t beat the location—right in the heart of the city, just steps from the iconic New Market and close to major attractions like the Indian Museum, Victoria Memorial, and Park Street. We could walk to most places or easily hop onto nearby transport.

We stayed in a well-appointed family room that was both spacious and comfortable. The beds were cozy, the air-conditioning worked perfectly (a must in Kolkata!), and the room was always spotless thanks to the attentive housekeeping team.

The highlight for us was the Blue & Beyond rooftop restaurant—stunning city views, delicious food, and a peaceful atmosphere. We enjoyed both Indian and continental dishes, and the kids especially loved the desserts! 

The staff went above and beyond to make our stay special. Whether it was arranging transportation, helping with directions, or offering extra amenities for our children, their hospitality was truly five-star.

The hotel also features a small but well-equipped fitness area, reliable Wi-Fi, and excellent room service. We felt safe, well-cared for, and thoroughly relaxed.

The Lindsay is perfect for families looking for a central, clean, and friendly place to stay in Kolkata. It’s a great blend of comfort, convenience, and charm. We left with full hearts and plenty of memories—already looking forward to our next visit!

Sunil Agarwal
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Agarwal,

Thank you for your glowing review and for choosing The Lindsay Hotel for your family trip to Kolkata! We’re absolutely delighted to hear that your stay was memorable and that our team could contribute to making it so special.

Your kind words about our central location, comfortable family accommodations, and especially our rooftop restaurant, Blue & Beyond, truly mean a lot. It's wonderful to know your family enjoyed the food, views, and warm hospitality—we aim to create exactly that kind of experience for our guests.

We’re particularly pleased that our team could assist with your needs and help make your children feel welcome. Your recognition of our staff’s efforts will be shared with them and will serve as great motivation.

We look forward to welcoming you and your family back on your next visit. Until then, thank you once again for your trust and kind words.

title: Great Location, Excellent Staff
text:
The Lindsay has a prime location with the swirl of Kolkata life just outside the secure door. I wanted to be nearer Eden Gardens to see IPL cricket and the choice was spot on. 

Staff are helpful and friendly.  My room had too much exposure to smoke and they moved me to  room with less smoke. Having non- smoking floors is something management may want to consider.  

The fabric of the building is aging and a little tired but everything works.  Good reliable wifi, attentive room services (I went out randomly according to my work but the room was always cleaned when I came back), generous supply of bottled water each day, a small refrigerator to keep water cold, an older but efficient shower with hot water, functioning elevators etc..  

I'd stay again.

title: Disgusting. I had cancelled my followup visit after my first experience. This is not a family hotel.
text:
Welcoming guest is horrible here. They are not ready for any online booking service. When I went to the front desk they couldn't recognize my online booking. Only after I showed them my confirmation slip they recognize me. 
They have charged me extra for my 12 years old son, but the charge was more than they have in their policy. The acknowledged the dispensary but didn't return me the extra money. Within the extra charge they didn't provide me any extra bed or any facilities.  
The room I stayed was blocked and dark. 
Customer service is poor and the are not interested on customer relation development.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Greetings from O2 HOTELS, Kolkata.

Our sincere apology for the inconvenience You faced,

However on Your arrival You shared us with the Voucher No. of Booking.com instead You could have told Your name which is easier to recognize the Guest Concern booked through online. Voucher Numbers are long and is tough to remember.

Children upto 10 Years sharing the same room with the Parents and without extra bed is complimentary as per the policy, However in Your case a 12 Year Children is charged and is again as per the policy.
We have issued You the Bill of the amount You paid us for Extra Bed @ 799.00 + Tax so no question of returning the money arises because You have not paid us anything extra.

We will look into the matter with Booking.Com. why such discrepancy happened with the rate of Extra Bed so that we have better control as far Customer Service / Relation Development is concern 

We look forward to welcome You again @ HOTEL O2 OXYGEN and assure You our best services as always.

Thanks and Regards
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Good Place
text:
Got a very good deal for the night and chose to stay over instead of driving across the city to my relative's place.
The Front Desk was very courteous and the check-in was brisk.. The only issue I had here that they and the security insisted that I leave my car keys with them which I refused. They accepted, BUT the front desk told the security at least 2-3 times my presence that he could go and knock my door at 2am/ 3am/ 4am whenever he required the keys. This was just trying to intimidate me, and was uncalled for. The car was parked as per their instructions in the designated area and wouldn't hamper anyone's movement at all.
Fine. They didnt require it at all.
The Rooms were quite functional and decent. Had a nice sleep after a long drive there.
The Breakfast was decent. If I'm in Kolkata and require to stay in that part of the city, I would definitely check-in here again.

title: Fine stay in close proximity to Airport.
text:
I stayed at O2 Oxygen recently during my kolkata stay. 

The room was alloted in b wing of the hotel which looked new and was well maintained. The room size was good and the room interior was ok. The room was very neat and clean and was equipped mini bar, led tv and safe deposit vault. The tea maker was provided on request. The aircondition was working perfectly. The room had twin bed and the bed was comfortable and linen was clean. The complimentary wifi was poor in connection and speed. 
The bathroom was of adequate size and was maintained well. The window of room was opening in some nearby lane. 

The buffet dinner was limited in spread but good in taste. The overall good quality was good.  Two Complimentary water bottle of kinley of 500 ml each was also provided. 

The sleep quality was decent. 

I had to checkout early in the morning at 4:10 and hotel arranged for a quick morning snacks of veg sandwitch, muffins, banana and tea, cofee and packed juice which was very nice on hotels part. 

The checkout was quick and smooth. The hotel arranged drop to kolkata airport. It took 5 minutes to reach the airport. The hotel stay was satisfactory. 

This one comes recommended if you want to stay at VIP road very near to airport.

title: Ideal for flight layover stay
text:
Checked out now after a few hours stopover. Airport pick up and drop is a tad expensive @ 350 for a 5 min drive to hotel. 
Plus points location, location location. With 150 rooms this hotel is spread across 3 buildings.  Check-in & check-out was super quick.. stayed at newly introduced B wing. rooms have efficient aircon. Flat tv, closet, 2 single seater sofa, tea coffee maker. Internet speed is average. You can request for smoking room. The bell boy was very polite and smiling. He seemed to be very excited for fifa match and enthusiastically switched on the match for me.
Minus points: bar closes at 11.15pm..I checked in at 11.30 and by the time I reached my room and placed request for a drink,  it was politely regretted. Tea coffee maker didn't have stirrer or spoon. 

Checkout was again super prompt.. Airport drop took me 5 min. 

Will recommend for a stay... didn't try the other facilities at hotel as my stay was for the wee hours only.

Overall, I highly recommend The Lindsay for a great stay. Special thanks to Veer, a staff member there.

title: Average, overpriced rooms
text: The hotel is running because of it’s location.The only thing I appreciated about my stay was that they arranged for an early check-in as requested. The rooms didn’t justify the prices charged. I had booked two rooms, one had a hard mattress and when I said about this at reception, the staff insisted that all their rooms have the best mattresses. The taps didn’t work properly in this room and the AC was for namesake. The housekeeping staff were polite, I really appreciate their hospitality. But the staff at the breakfast buffet had no sense of good service and the breakfast itself was way below average. The rooms were not very soundproof we could hear people talking in their rooms across the hall and it was disturbing.

title: Worst, Depressive and Unpleasant stay
text:
Worst, Depressive and Unpleasant stay at The Lindsay Kolkata from 21st Nov to 24th Nov 2024why-
1.) Quality of Room
Room quality is not up to the mark which they are showing on multiple websites. Size is too  small and you need to adjust your body to use the washrooms. The soap dispenser was not working and after complaints also not attended. Cleanliness is somewhat compromised. Don't know how this qualified for a 3 star hotel 
2.) Gunda or Rude behaviour of receptionist and Security guard
The hotel does not have car parking it's fine but they are looting the public if you want to park your car. I will tell my incident in brief over here-
I checked into the hotel on 21st Nov 2024. I had my  car which I parked in an unused place at night on a government road. The hotel staff told me that there is  chargeable underground parking here if you want to use it then you can use it at Rs. 500 per day then I said that in the early morning I will take my car and go to my work and again late night will come so it will work for me.
The next day they said that if you park outside on the road side then also you need to pay charges and they asked me to pay Rs. 1000. They asked me to pay the amount to the head of security guards and they were following me hard day and night and on the 23rd Night the receptionist called me at 11.45 in night to pay that Rs. 1000 and threatened me that if you will not pay than once you are outside the hotel then anything can happen with you. I replied okay let it be. So in summary they forgot all of our issues regarding room and soap dispenser and just focusing on their 1000 Rs. which does not belong to them and not sure they are going to keep with themselves or going to pay any third party.

It's my own experience which I faced on my stay booking ID  GH77247230327162. If you don't believe then stay and let's enjoy the behaviour of the staff and Room.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Roam53280852980

We want to sincerely apologize for your negative experience at The Lindsay. Our aim is to provide a relaxing and enjoyable experience for all our guests, and it is clear that we fell short in this instance. We truly value your feedback as it helps us improve our services. We hope you will give us another chance to provide you with the experience you deserve.

General Manager

title: Ver high charges
text:
The rooms are small and though I had requested a room with enough natural light, we were given a room with a small window. The runner on the bed was dirty. The fittings in the bathroom were old and semi rusted. Electricity went off twice with no battery back . Breakfast is charged at Rs 354 per person. We were charged Rs 3500 for the room for two of us with no  additional benefit. Except for the location, the price is far too high. They should not charge more than Rs 2000 per room per night. I had recommended this hotel to my cousin for day use and the hotel charged them Rs 4000 for two dirty rooms for about 10 hours usage.
Also as far as possible please do not use Agoda because they do not have an Indian office and you are left in the lurch for any assistance.

title: Hotel was good but the manager Mr.Rocky very very rude
text: We visited O2 on our transit from Singapore to Patna.We landed in kolkata at 11 and next day morning we had our flight at 11.So to spend the night we searched for hotels near airport and found this to be a decent one. We were a family of four We 2 and our two daughters aged 10 and 13.When we reached the hotel at around 12 the manager Mr.Rocky was extremely rude to talk to, very unprofessional and had no feeling of hospitality. At that odd hour he made us wait at the reception and insisted on the ID's of all 4 to be duely signed.We all are world travevellers and never the children were asked to give their IDs and signatures at the time of hotel check-in.He even insisted to give full payment at that time without any bill. Both the children were charged at full price though the little one was sharing the bed with us. In short though the hotel is new and well maintained still we would never recommend anybody to go there because of such an unwelcoming attitude of the manager Mr.Rocky.

Hardly 10 minutes drive from the airport this hotel is comfortable for an overnight stay, eventhough you may find it a bit far away from your business place.  The hotel is good, the staff excellent and service is good. Check out time is 12 Noon and no leniency on that.

placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Staying in the airport might be a better option
text:
Trying to find something good to say about this hotel. Two things I came up with was that it was clean enough to have an overnight rest and it is near the airport.
We were off to a bad start before I even stepped into the hotel. My pick-up from the arrival was nowhere to be seen. I think he may have gone to the domestic terminal gates. My office had communicated many times to ensure that the pick-up will be there when I exit the terminal but alas! It was not to be.
After a call and some time of waiting, he finally came & we’re off to the hotel. We ran into a huge traffic jam just to get out of the airport area; many lanes converging to a few exit lanes. Good for me that the driver was able to weave in & out to get us out of there fast! If you can help it, stay at the airport to wait for your connecting flight. It’s not worth the hassle to get to the hotel and back. That’s why I cancelled my reservations for my return flight though I had to wait more than 7 hours for my connecting flight.
When I arrived at the hotel, I was not made to feel welcomed at all. The reception was professional AND cold. It was impossible to get a smile out of both the men at the counter. I tried again the next morning but to no avail. One would think that people in the service industry would be friendlier and smiley. Maybe the nightmare of the sudden announcement by the Indian government that 500 & 1,000 rupee notes are not valid anymore added to their woes!
If you stay here, please ensure that you booked the hotel with breakfast as there are no noteworthy places to eat around the hotel. So though the breakfast is rather mediocre, I’m thankful that I could at least have some toast and hard-boiled eggs.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Greetings from O2 HOTELS,Kolkata
We immensely value our association with You.

Our heartiest thanks to You that You find our Rooms Clean and You had a comfortable stay.

However Your Airport Pick Up was not organised by us.

My sincere apology to You that the Front Office personnel did not smiled at You but I believe that they greeted You by wishing You on Your arrival and we serve Mini Breakfast from 04.00 AM in the morning and Full Buffet Breakfast from 07.00 AM comprises of Continental and Indian Cuisine. 

We look forward to serve You again at O2 HOTELS,Kolkata and assure You our best services as always 

Thanks and Regards

title: GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY
text:
Located at Kaikhalli, the O2 Hotel is just a stone throw away from the city's air terminal. This boutique hotel is a great advantage to those who choose to fly in to the metropolis. Check in as a leisure tourist or as a business traveler at the hotel and avail all the facilites ensuring every comfort and luxury to cheirsh your stay. Positioned at just 10 minutes drive from Sector V, the hotel connects well to this sprawling business hub of the city. You are also welcome to unleash your desires for endless shopping at the City Centre II which is less than 2 kms away from the hotel.

Situated near shops and markets, the 3-star Hotel O2 Vip welcomes guests with 29 luxurious rooms.

Major Kolkata sights, such as Nicco Park, Dain-Thlen Falls and Tagore Museum are located nearby. This deluxe venue is 10km away from the center of Kolkata.

Hotel O2 Vip offers rooms with a contemporary interior, individual climate control, Wi-Fi, a minibar, satellite TV and a writing desk. They are equipped with coffee/tea makers.

The hotel’s excellent restaurant serves a variety of Chinese dishes. The modern bar serves a selection of coffee and tea.

Due to its location 5 km from Netaji Subhas Chandra airport, it will take only 5 minutes to get there.

Guests can avail of a lift, free parking and a cash machine as well as a photocopier, a meeting room and a business center provided on site.

The hotel offers a nightclub and a rooftop terrace to make your stay more enjoyable.

title: Budget friendly  hotel in close proximity to  the  Kolkata airport.
text:
For all those weary travellers who need to hop on and hop off the flight there could be no better option than this Hotel located on VIP Road   just a few minutes ride from Kolkata Airport.
The rooms are decent and so are the  mattresses.The room may not be big enough but for the short stay and the  logistical advantages  it scores over the other  hotels.The  lounge is good and the typical bengali preparations are good.
The toilets are clean .The lift is a bit "too" compact. The passages are dimly lit  but the windows in the room  fill it with the  natural light.
The aircon  works fantastic .
The rooms  have the charging point which  are far away from the bed. so your phone charges away from you when u are in the bed.But does it really matter?

The  biggest  plus is the close proximity to the airport, accessible within  minutes by a cab.What more could you expect in  the beaming metropolis  of India where the chances of getting  stuck up in the traffic is remote if O2 gives you that advantage !!!

title: A close hotel to Airport
text: We stayed at this hotel for just 1 night before we could catch our flight next day morning. This hotel is decent and very near to the Airport, you can reach this hotel by taxi within 5-10 minutes from airport which is an added advantage. The downsize is that not all taxi will be willing to make a trip to hotel as the distance is short and you may end up paying a bit more. Rooms at the hotel are not too big. The bathroom is little small as well. The hotel rooms had centralized AC, we did face challenges with airflow in room due to the placement of AC vents in the room. It did make the room little hot & stuffy. People as reception were friendly and helped us check in within very little time though we checked in at the hotel very late around 2 AM in the morning.  The hotel serves buffet breakfast in the morning, the choice of spread for breakfast and quality of food was good. The good thing was the breakfast was ready by 7.00 AM in the morning with all dishes placed. This will really help travelers to grab a quick breakfast before they can catch their flight. On the price this hotel is definitely expensive. You can opt for this hotel if you are really short of time and want to stay very close to airport.

title: Stay only for location.
text:
I stayed at O2 for a night while returning from Guwahati  . I had to catch early morning flight and this hotel was one of the nearest to Airport hence I booked here and stayed overnight.

The room size was small and the interior was not impressive. The paint work was going on and the room has strong paint odour which I am allergic to. I requested the reception to change the room but they denied stating that no other room was vacant  . It was difficult staying there  however I managed to stay as I had no option. 

The airconditioner was working well and room had TV too. 

The bathroom was poorly maintained and shower area was straggly designed behind a column. I checked out early morning . It took hardly ten minutes to reach to Airport from here.  I hired a normal cab as drop charges of hotel was quite high.the hotel also offers complimentary breakfast which I couldn't try as I checkout early.

Overall a very average experience staying here.  There are better options near airport.  Stay here only for the location.

title: Short Break to India...!!
text: The stay is for two night with my wife and infant daughter, it may not be the best international experience but i can say the trip and stay was good and cheerful. The staff was responsive and helpful. The rooms are clean with good ambiance. Before reaching I booked Premium Super deluxe in advance but after checking-in and see the room the space was not so convenience as show in website. However i have upgraded my room to Premium Suite. I should thank the gentlemen Mr. Subhradeep for the flexibility provided in upgrading my room. The suite rooms are located on the road side, there is little disturbance from the traffic however i wish to compromise on the space for my daughter to play. Food was good. Amenities are provided as mentioned. I recommend families to choose suite rooms if you have money to pay. Had done lots of shopping in City Center mall which is very close and also in New market though it is very rush. There was a delay in my pickup which i was not so happy. However if i visit India(Kolkata) i surely think of staying in O2. Thanks guys ..!!

title: Don't expect anything great !
text:
This is a very regular business hotel, and because of its location is able to charge a premium. Else this would qualify as a budget hotel.

The rooms are just ok, and everything in the hotel seems old and falling apart. The place is not very clean but one can live with it. The rooms are small and just liveable. Food is below average and I would recommend that one should eat outside. There are some great restaurants in Kolkata as well as near to the hotel. Service is poor to mediocre. A big problem with this hotel is that it hosts large number of events and conferences for various companies and these are day events. Hence the place can be very noisy both in the day and night.

Not recommended for families and if you plan to have a relaxing time. If are a part of the conference well then with company the place anyways becomes secondary. Those who plan to drive to the place, please note the place has no great parking facilities and the road outside can be very loud and jammed during peak hours.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Completely bungled my stay

title: Good Hotel!!
text:

Food is good... Overall its a nice hotel to stay..

They just need to improve on laundry services and their reception as they have a laid back attitude.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Just Fine .. Nothing Great .. Not Value for Money
text:
Location is ok .. Locality is good ..
Rooms are spacious .. but some how there is dampness even the beds seem cold and moist .. maybe they take it from the staffs cold behavior .. 
Rooms are with coffee tea maker, TV , Fridge et al .. no problem on this front ..
Service .. You need to search for it .. You receive it but no smiles as you may expect after paying the high bucks .. not even at the reception .. rough tough treatment ..
Restaurant food is expensive .. however .. it is tasty and lets you satisfied if not happy ..
They have a misconception that they are a 4-5 star hotel .. which someone has to remind them soon if they need to stay in business ..
Breakfast is limited variety and again bad service .. maybe my previous hotels have pampered me too much .. you may check for yourself and correct me ..
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Very Good Hotel
text: Stayed for a night and found to be a good hotel in the city. Room was spacious and very clean and with all the facilities. Sleep quality was good. Breakfast was complimentary and had many varieties. Lovely staff and would visit again. Room service food items are expensive.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: OK but over priced
text:
Hi I stay in this hotel for business visits and am bound by my offie to stay here.. 

food during breakfast is spicy. the hotel atmosphere is smelly and greasy with oils.. the rooms are average.. toiletries like soap needs improvement.. 

I suaully avoid having breakfast here and eat outside..
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Most weired hotel visited in recent past!!!!
text:
In last 17 years of extensive travel this is the first time I came across any hotel which demanded 100% advance payment for the duration of our stay. This is despite the fact that the booking was done from our company under corporate and with discount!! when I enquired if this was the procedure even for any one coming to the hotel on personal visit their answer was affirmative... Strange ... very strange.. And the staff had not even a slightest embarrassment on their face when I asked this uncomfortable question....

The reception staff was horrible... No manners.. No etiquettes. they did not even seem from Hospitality Industry and that to from Front Desk!!!  There body language showed as if they are obliging us allowing them to stay in their hotel and as if we were staying there for free....I had a feeling of typical "Culture" from their behaviour. Slow speed of working.. Pathetic style.. careless attitude..

Nothing else is worth writing.. Location and entry is depressing and unsafe.. staff non-cooperative, facilities below standard... 

Food was average as we had dinner that night. Restaurant staff was slightly better...

Overall rating poor however with grace can be elevated to Average.. waste of money wouldn't recommend to anyone...
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Nothing Golden!
text: This is an average property with excellent. There is no parking place and your car for moving around will have to be far away from the hotel. The room view if not in the frontside is depressing. The lobby and the entrance is mostly crowded as there are lots of meetings going on in the hotel. The restaurant is average and the breakfast doesnt start your day on a promising note.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Improve breakfast experience
text: Stuck with a wrong badly informed choice of 'serviced appartment' in Kolkata park street, I had to quickly find a room to stay as it was getting late. I made a few calls and decided to go to Golden Park Calcutta. Strangely, the entrance is off the main road, a little obscure! The moment i entered I thought I was somewhere down south - so typical of the southern hotels was the small lobby-foyer. The room was ok, but the breakfast was a let down- the breakfact area was almost dingy place. Or maybe I have been papmered bad by better experience. Maybe because of this a lone I will not repeat the place. For the cost of a room night with breakfaxt, the place HAS to improve.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Excellent location!!
text:
This property is a classic mid-size business hotel in the heart of Kolkata. It is located close to many historic locations, central markets and places of interest.

Let me also say this at the outset- this is a pure business hotel that host conferences, pretty much, on a daily basis so if you are thinking of a quiet family time at a hotel then this may not be the place for you. This hotel is great for staying at a central point, going out there in the city during the day time, and coming back for sleep only. 

The hotel rooms are alright for a business hotel. The food at the restaurant is good, and the kitchen staff is happy to accommodate your special requests as well. The staff is well informed about local attractions and places. 

All in all, this hotel knows how to take care of their guests with all the limitations. There can be many improvements that I can suggest such as noise control during parties and conferences and proper cleaning in rooms.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Value for Money
text: This is a value for money property at heart of the city. You stay connected to the entire city because of it's locational advantage and the staff are pretty old in the hotel who have spent a great amount of time in the property.

title: great location

placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Basking in Demand-Supply Gap
text:
The only good point about this hotel is its location. Quite strategically located behind Tata Centre and in close vicinity of some of the major offices. This always keeps it in strong demand and they generally run overbooked 365 days a year. So when they anticipate a peak in demand due to upcoming conference or meets, they just like any opportunist hike its rates. 

Quite naturally Service Orientation is not on its radar as they are not starved for customers. There restaurant for breakfast is very very basic and so is the menu. You can expect better breakfasts in some of the Guest Houses in Kolkata. They do have a club (discotheque) which can be avoided. Very empty on weekdays and lewd on weekends. 

Room sizes are good and cleanliness average (You might find torn bed-sheets), All in all can ok for overnight in-transit stay... but not at all value-for-money.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Nice property, staff does not care
text:
This was  a stay for a short work trip (4 nights),  and I felt they could improve a lot.  They have a lovely old world charm 
Pros: 
Central location, near New Market
Beautiful property, old world charm, some rooms have large windows
Great food, even simple room service food is spectacular
Nice roof top restaurant

Cons: 
Staff seems to have lost interest, simply dont care. 
I was served soup in a dirty infected bowl (see pic). All I got was a sorry, next morning the manager acted as if its no big deal. Was not offered a refund, was charged in full. 
My colleague who is 6 feet 4 inches tall,  asked thrice for his two beds to be joined. On the third night, he actually begged, before the staff paid any heed. 
Rooms are not cleaned well. Cockroaches in the bathroom are a common site
They shamelessly charge you for extra tea and coffee sachets, that too RS 10 per sachet!! Someone please tell them that coffee sachets costs about Rs 2 and tea is Ra 5. 
Staff is rude to a point, they a single lady traveler is not helped to carry her luggage to her car, parked less than 100 meters away. 

I don't recommend, unless the staff and management wakes up. Sadly might have to stay there again, as my company travel agent books with them.
ownerResponse/text:

title: 'ALL OUR ROOMS ARE SMOKING ROOMS! - Beware!
text:
GOLDEN PARKK, KOLKATA, INDIA

NOV 21, 2012

This appears to be a fine property that was started with all the best ideas but then ran out of steam/inspiration. I was frankly puzzled why this great looking property is not run better!

Positives

1	Great location, if you have business in the area and/or want to workout, as I did, in the relatively clean air near abouts the Victoria Memorial Hall. There is a small but extremely clean place called 'Mohor Kunj' opposite the Planetarium, that is very nice and free.

2.   	Inside nicely done, room furnishings very nice, bathroom well done, good water pressure, plenty hot water; linen not so fresh, a little grungy. Ample towels, good and plentiful toiletries. I am a sucker for green Marble!

3.	Great restaurant! Deep Menu, tasty and fresh stuff. Stay away from the Buffet though, as I should have done :( ; those serving spoons spread bad hygiene like wild fire; the GI distress hit me half way between Dubai and SFO. Food ordered from the Menu were superb. The personnel were attentive and well groomed. I would patronize the restaurant even if I were staying elsewhere!

Negatives	

1	The Reception personnel need to be sharper and trimmer; nothing a little training and reduced 'carb' diet won't fix! Also they need not be so curious about a guest's Passport as to check out every page, as if reading a book! I have not noticed this degree of interest in a guest's Passport anywhere else! Just make a freaking copy and hand it back. Very un-professional, IMHO!

Also why not organize your reception like most other Hotels? Have your check-in clerks stand up behind a podium, while greeting guests; as a guest checking-in, I do NOT want to sit down; its not like filling in a form for opening a bank checking account! Just one signature, hand over the key and away you go! 

2.	Made me pay for the room in advance; while checking-in! Now, where in the world in a respectable Hotel, does one pay in advance while checking in? Creates a very bad impression! 

3.	All rooms are SMOKING rooms! The woman at the desk told me so right away; I had specifically and emphatically asked for a non-smoking room; it is a deal breaker for me. No where in the web site does it say that 'There are no non-smoking rooms'! It should, so as to not mis-lead Customers. Again, a nice property such as this, needs to stomp out smoking everywhere, including the front entrance. Pretty disgusting to see people lining up outside the front door, puffing away! My room was sprayed heavily with freshener, when I checked in; by the morning the spray had worn off and the room smelled like an ashtray; spent the rest of the day in the restaurant, which is, 'thank god', non-smoking. 

4. The front drive thru of the Hotel is jammed with cars, all day! Now this is a fire/safety/security hazard of gigantic proportions! Get them cars outta there and find other parking facilities. Again, it bears repeating, such a nice property with much potential, has these glaring faults, its mind boggling.

5	There was one hidden charge on checkout, for using the internet for reservation! Trifle amount, but such charges create a very bad impression. Say it out loud up front; people do not mind paying, they hate being blind sided!

6	Web site needs work; many spelling mistakes; the word 'complement' was used many times where clearly 'compliment' was intended. Come on, Indian folks have good command over the language, don't they?!

Final Thoughts

	Great property; need some 'whipping into shape' type work! Also, in my book, absence of non-smoking rooms, is a deal breaker. 

Hope this review is constructive and helpful.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Not a happy experience! Beware hotel bookings on agoda!
text:
Had a confirmed booking on agoda for this hotel. When I reached the hotel, they refused to accept my booking as they said agoda had not confirmed the booking with them. I tried calling agoda (whose helpline no is in the U.S). Got cut off every time a customer care executive came on the phone. Finally got my office to call then. They suggested an alternate hotel as they said the hotel did not have a room. When I informed them that the hotel did indeed have a room, they got back saying that the hotel will honor the voucher. I checked with the hotel and they did confirm that the voucher will be accepted. 

This was not the end of it. While checking out I was presented with a bill towards the tariff of the room. When I asked them why this was done they informed me that in the evening agoda had called them and told them that they will not honor the voucher. I asked for the email from agoda which they were not able to provide me. After constant back and forth they finally accepted the voucher and I checked out. 

As far as the hotel is concerned it is centrally located. The rooms are small but adequate. The breakfast is average. I happened to be on the second level. The other guests were extremely noisy till very late in the night. 

All in all an overpriced, well located hotel which I hope I do not have to stay in again!!
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Stay at Golden Parkk Kolkata

title: Central location, makes it a keeper
text:
I,ve stayed here about four timers now and the location makes it's a good bargin.
Word of caution however to my fellow Nort American travelers.  This is a Indian business hotel not and not the Hilton.  If your looking for the Hilton or Crown Plaza this is'nt you hotel.
For me it save an hours commute opposed to staying in a western flagged hotel and the rooms are are clean and the flood is safe. 
The Fusion bar also makes a mean G&T.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Good choice for business travellers
text: The location of Hotel Golden Parkk is the best advantage it has.The food is tasty & the spread is good.The rooms are clean, hygienic & well maintained.A friendly & helpful staff at all times. The hotel also has good conference facilities hence it is mostly always booked for meetings. Hassle free check in & check out. Hotel Golden Parkk just ensures that your stay is comfortable & relaxing.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Ideal hotel for business trips
text:
The first advantage of this hotel is its location. Located at just back side of Tata Center, all sorts of transports are always available, it is also not far off from park street, which is full of good restaurants & centre of city's night life.
The room was decent & specious, but the mattress was bit hard & was causing bit discomfort. The major problem was that toilet was not fitted with a hand faucet & one had to use bucket & mug, if required.
Varity was less in the breakfast spread, but food was good. Like other 3 star hotels, food was costly, so I mostly tried the good restaurants of Park strret, which was nearby.
Overall look of the hotel was impressive, fitted with two, big, capsule lifts & service was also very prompt. I liked check in & out, as it took only 2 minutes each time.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Very good central hotel
text:
I was traveling with my family to Kolkata for the first time. Was little apprehensive as not heard good things about safety/professionalism of Kolkata. This hotel was booked by a friend. Let me jot down the +ves of this hotel :

1. Centrally located (all major shopping/eating areas were walking distance)
2.Very safe (in fact the hotel is located between the US and UK consulates). So lot of police on the road.
3. Very good and wholesome buffet breakfast (which runs from 7 am to 10.30 am)
4. Helpful and friendly staff 
5. Easy check in procedure and in fact they gave us late checkout which really worked for us as a family
6. Do go for a early morning walk at the beautiful Victoria Memorial which is very close by.

Highly recommended !
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: A moderately good business hotel centally located in kolkata.

title: Good for conferences
text:
Stayed at the hotel on 20th to 22nd Nov.

Positives : 
Great location, bang in the middle of the city with close proximity to the Victoria Memorial, the shopping area and the metro.
The rooms are decently large and decently maintained.
Food is palatable and fairly reasonable
The hotel staff are very friendly. Right from the reception to the waiters in the restaurant to the staff handling the conferences, everyone goes out of the way to help
Have got over 7 large halls for conferences.

Negatives : 
The rooms could have been maintained better.
Given the number of conferences you have a lot of people, not necessarily hotel guests, in the lobby and conference areas giving the hotel a crowded look.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Room service
text:
The service offered by Dipankar as a room service is niceFeedback on Room Service
Overall, the room service experience was satisfactory. The staff was generally polite and efficient in taking orders. However, there were a few areas where improvements could be made:
Positives:
 * Prompt service: Orders were delivered within a reasonable timeframe.
 * Pleasant staff: The room service attendants were courteous and helpful.
Areas for Improvement:
 * Food quality: The quality of the food could be enhanced, particularly in terms of flavor and presentation.
 * Menu variety: A wider range of options, especially for dietary restrictions and preferences, would be appreciated.
 * Packaging: The packaging of food items could be more eco-friendly and less wasteful.
 * Attention to detail: Small details, such as ensuring correct orders and providing necessary utensils, can significantly impact the overall experience.
By addressing these areas, the room service experience can be elevated to provide guests with a truly exceptional dining experience.

title: Fabulous!
text: This is a great place to stay. Stayed here with family during my transit and believe me this turned out to be a fantastic stay. The location is great near to some good restaurant and in a calm serenity. The communication is great from this place. The check in super fast and as for the check out. The rooms are good sized and with all the required amenities. The food was good, but the breakfast spread was forgettable. The place is over staffed and thus sometime becomes a bit hard to communicate. The person who checked me out was super cool( sorry forgot his name) packed breakfast for us and when he came to know that our flight is delayed, offered us room again for us to stay back. Super gesture :). The staff every where were so good and welcoming. Felt so great about the stay. Would definitely recommend.

title: Clean, decent 3 to 4 star place.
text:
Stayed at the O2 while on an late night stopover at Kolkatta airport. Its less than a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport. There are two O2 hotels side by side - 'O2 'and then the 'O2VIP'. Apparently there must quite a bit of confusion among the guests, coz the hotel security kept my taxi waiting until I had confirmed my stay at the O2.
Location: By the side of a 4 lane busy road. 
External appearence - Rather poor by international standards; But pretty OK inside.
Rooms and amenities: Rooms are good, modern (looks recently refurbished) adequately sized, with quality fittings esp in the bathrooms;  Good wifi, sofas, writing desk and flat screen TV. Sleep was comfortable. 
Free buffet breakfast was nice with a selection of north and south Indian dishes & and basic western breakfast.

title: Mediocre
text:
I was travelling by myself, first time in India, booked this hotel for the first night. The descriptions online did not match the hotel exactly but I was just glad to have a bed. 
Rooms were spacious and clean, staff was very, very, very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the wifi did not work which was somewhat unlucky for me because I was travelling alone and had many people waiting for a response from me! The manager was trying to help me all night, unfortunately it didn't work but thank you so much for trying!
The room had only windows in a tiny, dirty courtyard, which first I thought was good/ no noise from the streets BUT at 4 in the morning there was very loud hare krishna music coming from outside (obnoxiously loud) which lasted for 4 hours and was a bit exhausting to me.
Food was really good, enjoyed breakfast and newspaper. 
All in all, it was a little expensive for my taste and what expected me there but the staff was exceptionally nice!
