title: Parkk or Park?
text:
While pondering the question, one can also admire the opulent lobby of this rather chunky looking hotel at the historic Ho Chi Minh street of the city.
The rooms are claimed to have a boutique look but this seems to be restricted to rather garish primary colors.
The rooms at the rear overlook a large vacant lot while those at the front face the street.
Hotel Golden Park (it has a second "k" by the way)is also known for its huge, cavernous disco lounge bar restaurant which is supposedly filled up at weekends. There are also nearly 14 conference rooms, banquet halls and meeting rooms which explains the frequent movement of groups of people in the breaks around the hotel.
Food is of an acceptable standard as it is generally in most hotels here.
The location of the hotel is central for the historic quarter and with the UK Deputy High Commission and the U.S. Consulate round the corner security should not be a concern.
Basically attractive to the business traveler large family groups were also seen frequenting the hotel ahead of the holday season.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: A Business hotel

During the process of making fast bucks , hotel management had curtiled most of amenities like swimming pool , health club etc. you can't find any hing in this hotel to relax except a T.V that also changed to L.C.D recently  from eye teasing old sets. Its a absolute business hotel where number of business meetings takes places every day and lobby is always fully crowded with business people who came to attend to meetings in this hotel halls. title: Hotel Golden Park, Kolkata - an example of day by day Deteriorated Service & Standard
text:
Located around a kilometer away from the Victoria Memorial and the Maidan, this hotel is basically meant for business travelers. It is in the centre of the city and opposite to Metro Plaza - a shopping mall.

I stayed in this hotel many times. First I stayed in February 2004 and afterwards many times. But unfortunately over these years I have observed a continuous downfall in the service and standard of this hotel. When for the first time I stayed in this hotel I was really enjoyed my stay there. Good location, good room, good food, good service – everything was excellent. I in fact was delighted to have such a kind good hotel in the centre of Kolkata as I require traveling frequently to this city on business as well as personal works. But to my dismay, day by day I discovered a sharp deterioration in their service and standard. The most noticeable factor was the attitude of the staffs; starting from door keeper to reception and service staff – they all work but no smiling, professionalism or welcoming attitude reflects. Porters, room boy, housekeeping staff – all are after tips in an indecent manner. 

Though outside view is not so good, inside the hotel it is beautiful. A small lobby space, modern lift, touch of Egyptian art in the lobby & common space and painting works in room corridor areas. As far room is concerned it is good and comfortable. They provide complementary cookies and chocolate in the room which is a good part of their service. Toilet amenities provided are basic though early days there used to be some more high quality varieties. Shampoo and moisturizer given there not suitable to use. Last time I found towel smelly. Dirty water from toilet tap is a regular phenomenon.  

During our stays in the year 2004 to 2006, there used to be delicious varieties in buffet menu but during last few stays I found it degraded by one third in terms of varieties. 

My last stay there in the month of February for 2 nights on the way to Mumbai. In the last night I could not sleep properly as a late night party was going on; drum bits coming from there were very much disturbing. The music and dance floor was sound-proof. The following day I had the early morning flight for Mumbai and requested the staff and manager in-charge to do the needful so that I could have a sound slip but they did nothing other than expressing their apologies. At around 2:30 am the party was over and I managed a short nap till 4 am, then rushed for airport. 

What seems to me is lack of professionalism and proper management causing this hotel towards deterioration. Since it has many positive factors, the hotel can be turned into first class business standard hotel if total management and staff of the hotel can be changed.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Beware of checking out scam
text:
This hotel is conveniently situated but not cheap at 2000 rupies per night plus luxury tax.  Room service has 10% service charge.  All this was fine and we stayed for five nights.  At no stage were we offered clean towels - my daughter and I had one towel between us for the five nights.  Housekeeping rarely answered the telephone.  When we called room service, a tip was expected (despite the 10% service charge) and we payed as we ordered in order to avoid disputed extra additions at the end.  During the first three days we tipped but when we started getting the wrong change back - i.e. fifty rupies less and then grumpy apologies when I questioned the change, we stopped tipping.  We started not getting change unless I demanded it.  They always rounded up to the nearest ten but rounding up to the nearest hundred was a bit much.

  I paid in advance for the accommodation asking exactly what the final cost for the room including all taxes would be so that they didn't come up with something new at the end.

However, when we went to check out, we were asked to pay 200 rs for the "damaged towel".  The grey, brown "white" towel had dropped on the bathroom floor and so was dirty (two people had used it in dusty Kolkata for five days at a "luxury" hotel.  I was furious and asked for a bucket of water and soap as it would take three minutes to wash it.  However, I was told that the towel was too damaged now to be used again so I must pay for a new one.  I suspect I was not the only victim of this scam as often we had heard loud abusive screaming in the mornings which I realised must have been other people checking out and facing the same scam.  Also, they had all the room service boys and several staff at receptiion all demanding the 200rs in a group.  Hardly a pleasant exit to what would have been a reasonable stay.  It left a very bitter taste in my mouth and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Don't expect fancy, but quite a nice place
text: I've traveled to India (Kolkata/Calcutta, specifically) since I was a little girl, and I can tell you that this place exceeded all my expectations for Kolkata and even India. While it may not measure up to the expectations of wealthy spoiled Americans, it is quite reasonable for anyone who has grown up middle class in developed nations, students just out of college or even hardy older travellers. My husband and I relaxed in the room after a flight from Delhi and enjoyed tea and cookies in our room. My biggest fear, the plumbing, was entirely unfounded because the shower in this hotel was the BEST of all the hotel showers in India I tried (the worst perhaps in Goa). The toilet flushed fine, the room was clean and contrary to the review above, I did not smell anything bad or detect a mildew problem (I read the review before I went and almost changed my reservation, thank goodness we didn't). The staff was very courteous and even the downstairs restaurant.was reasonable. I didn't have any problems with this place at all and think it's fine for travellers who need a clean place to stay.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Avoid it, spend a little more
text: I stayed there November 2004-booked through Travelocity. Price was very reasonable USD 58 per night. Based on the price I expected it to be mid range hotel-something like Holiday Inn in USA. But I was wrong. This hotel need major work-specially in some rooms. I felt this hotel is very old and I could smell it in the air. Furniture, beds, curtains everything was old and smelly. We rented 2 rooms for 3 days, one of the room smelled very bad-smell of mild dew, dust, rotten woods etc. I had my room changed but the other room was as stinky as the first one. Ac went out oneday and TV on another day. On both occation 3/4 repair staff were send to the room the problems were fixed. The staffs are no doubt friendly but there is only so much they can do. One the 3rd day I got really sick. If you are from the west I strongly suggest you choose one of those 5 star hotel like Oberoi Grand or Taj Bengal instead of trying to save a few bucks like me. The city Kolkata is very hot and humid  in the daytime with no ac in the cabs-at night you desperately need a cool, fresh and comfortable room to get some sleep.
placeInfo/address: 13 Ho Chi Minh Sarani, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700071 India

title: Horrible experience
text: We booked the hotel as a stopover coz we saw nice reviews about the place. But we were sadly mistaken. We reached early and were made to wait for one and half hours before we were appointed a room. The reception staff were unhelpful to the last bit. On being informed that we had requested an early check-in the day before they asked us to show the voice recording of the msg. When we finally got the room we had to stumble around searching for it because no one bothered to show us. Entering the room was another nightmare. The furniture was chopped and the room was shabby as it gets. Bathroom was also dirty and we decided to checkout. On being told we are checking out the reception guy asked if we needed a bill. I mean if you are not refunding the amount and we are not staying also why the hell will we not require a bill. It was a traumatic experience to say the least. Luckily we found a place to stay if only by paying twice the amount because of the nightmare called indismart hotel. Wouldn't recommend anyone to stay .
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We always honor a guest and their feedback but till that point it is genuine. First of all, you charged and forced the staff at the reception for giving you a room as early checkin by falsely claiming of a telephonic conversation that had happened on the previous day. We had no room to offer on that day for early check in and on requesting you to produce the recording of the conversation which you had claimed, you failed to produce the proof of the discussion. You were given a superior room which we have given to many guests ( corporate/ leisure) without any negative feedback. You stayed in that room for more that 3-4 hours without any complaint. Sir, a hotel can redress or atleast try to redress any issue when it is brought out to light during a stay. Even then, our sincere apologies once again for the inconvenience caused to you!

title: FLEECERS & OPPORTUNSTS
text: As tour operators, we booked 03 rooms (06 Pax)for 3 nights( 06 & 07.Nov) (09 Nov) totaling 9 rooms.After 2 nights stay(06& 07 Nov), the guests checked out and left their luggage at Lindsay since we had booked for their stay on return from sunderbans which was on 09th Nov. Due to the cylone, the guests could not leave sunderbans on the 9th as scheduled as permission was not granted by the Govt for the ferry to ply. They had to stay back at Sunderbans and Thanks to Mr Vivek (+91-8334076522) who was our co-ordinator for sunderbans tour had taken care of our guests and accommodated them without even taking one extra penny and We do recognise his magnanimity  and help during this natural calamity. When we apprised Hotel Lindsay, the Manager  Mr Kanchan Mali (+91-9674165153) had bluntly told us that there cannot be a refund and if the guest don't turn up, the refund cannot be done. Airlines plying from Kolkata could not operate due to the cyclone and they have refunded the amount, BUT Hotel Lindsay, which is the heart of Kolkata refused...Lindsay has fleeced the guests in this regard and has resorted to an  unethical practice. We had even requested them to postpone the booking so that we could return the cost of the unoccupied rooms to the guests and utilise the booking/rooms at a convenient date when we have other guests travelling to kolkata. Even this,the manager Mr Kanchan Mali (+91-9674165153) refused to do and had the audacity to quote the hotel cancellation policy during natural calamity. SHAME, if this be the concept of Hospitality and the meaning of the word "ATITHI DEVO BHAVA". .I will be giving my feedback on all possible sites and shall apprise all guests to "BEWARE". Incase you want to contact me as to what trainspired, you  are welcome to call me at +91-9645079983 or +96330 39624. Mr Prasad, The Happy Tours India, Kochi, Kerala

title: Nice hotel in a good location.
text:
The Linsday is a nice hotel in a busy and central area of Calcutta. The hotel has a pretty good wifi, fridge, good sized rooms (we had a Junior Suite approx. $100 a night Australian), a decent buffet breakfast and some friendly staff.
It is central to all you may want. It is surrounded by markets and outlet shops, there are numerous restaurants within walking distance and Eden Gardens, Victoria Memorial and central Calcutta are also walkable should you wish. There are two toasted sandwich shops on the corner of Lindsay Street, which I would recommend to take back to the hotel for lunch.
Just one word of warning. If your taxi is going to arrive in the evening, it is hard to drive to the hotel because of the crowds of shoppers and you may end up walking a little way.
Over all it was a good comfortable stay and our room looked out onto the markets below.

title: Acceptable stay in crowded part of Kolkata. (3.5 stars?)
text:
Comfortable stay in the busy New Market area.
The room was spacious with a good a/c, a working fridge,  and overlooked New Market.
Having stayed in this area in much cheaper backpacker style accommodation on multiple occasions, I can certainly say The Lindsay was a step up in quality and comfort. Whether it is worth the price is debatable(hence he 3 star rating compared to 4 star), but it was nice to have a clean spacious room with reliable hot water and buffet breakfast included.
I was checked in quickly when I arrived after midnight.
The buffet breakfast has a variety of options and while not being one of the best I have had in terms of quality it was more than acceptable. The staff in the dining room for the breakfast were excellent. Very attentive, polite and professional.
The room was clean and although the bathroom was a bit dated it was also clean and had all the toiletries provided.
New Market can be a noisy area (especially during festival times) but that is the case in the centre of all Indian cities. Being on the 8th floor helped a little with this.
The hotel has what looked like a well equipped gym, although I have never used a gym and did not do so here. I have never stayed anywhere in central Kolkata that does not have a slight smell of mustiness to it. The Lindsay was no exception to this. I do not believe it is the hotel itself, but the pipes and drains of this area.

The biggest plus of The Lindsay was the rooftop bar/restaurant. It is very modern, well maintained, has excellent staff and a varied selection of well prepared food. I wouldn't call it cheap but I certainly did NOT find it overpriced. It is a wonderful spot to sit in the evening. When there is a gentle breeze it is a pleasant retreat from the often stifling Kolkata atmosphere. It provides very good views across the city. Once again I can say the staff in the rooftop restaurant were very professional and the food was of good quality.
The door staff at hotel entrance were always very polite, and while the reception and room staff could maybe improve a touch on their professionalism, they were all friendly and polite.
I'm usually a backpacker when traveling in India so it was nice to have a proper hotel room for my first couple of nights on this trip.

text: Primarily located at Kolkata's shopping hub, Lindsay must have seen its better days. Booked three executive rooms. All the room were not same upon checkin. The room I stayed had almost no view, though other two rooms were just okay!! Probably depends upon luck which room/view one shall get. Furniture's are outdated and few touch ups are in dying need. Only thing I liked about the washroom was its overhead fan!! Breakfast was good but not something extraordinary, that you can write about. Guy's sitting at the front desk has to handle guests with patience, could have been more polite. We noticed one of the front desk officer was literally shouting at a guest. Being said so in Kolkata if someone is in a food/shopping trip there's not much of option. Lindsay is one of the few, which fall into that category!!

title: Great location, nice clean hotel
text:
The best part is off course the location. Located just next to the New Market. So, if you are travelling for shopping, this one is certainly a great option. Keep in mind it's a very busy & crowded place with lots of option of street food.

We stayed in the Executive room which was spacious with clean bathroom. The Deluxe room is a bit small in size but enough for 02 adults. They provide bottled water, complimentary in room tea-coffee & standard bathroom amenities which was good. 

The hotel has a restaurant at the rooftop & another on the first floor where complimentary buffet breakfast is served. I must say there was enough variety & the food was tasty. Pls. check out the photos.

The metro is rail station is about a Kilometer away. Taxis are available throughout day & night. 

Overall, my experience of staying in The Lindsay was pleasant.

Highly recommended. Enjoy your stay.

title: Stay away from the garbage bin called Indismart Hotel
text:
Staying for one night in IndiSmart Hotel, Kolkata easily ranks as one of the worst hotel experiences for me. The hygiene standards are appalling – my room (#409) was infested with bed bugs and mosquitoes. The linen was stained and soiled – everything from towels, napkins to bedcovers (see pics). 

The staff is atrocious – they demand to know why you need fresh linen. There was no hot water in the shower; but the housekeeping staffer shamelessly tells me that the cold water is actually quite warm; perhaps the poor bloke suffers from a skin disease.

Finally, when they say that their restaurant serves breakfast at 7 am, it actually means 7:45 am, because the staff loiters around aimlessly not knowing what to do. 

Stay here only if you wish to suffer through a filthy slum-like experience
ownerResponse/text:

title: My last stay with IndiSmart
text:
This is not my first time and infact 4th time revisit to this property.But I am utter dissapointed this time. I shall list all the items of dissapointment below and leave the decision to the readers.
1. Upon arrival I went to their inhouse cafe for a cup of coffee and requested FO to send my trolley either to my room or to the cafe. When done, I found my trolley sitting as it is. I carried it up, seeing which no one from FO offered any help to call a Bell Boy.
2. The room had dampended wall and I booked one of the best rooms @Premium/Premier room with BF
3. Bed base upholstry were torn at places
4. The luggage rack's sunmica were broken and coming off
5. Bathroom dustbin was old, rusty and broken. The lid was wobbling
6.Bath area door handle came of as I touched it and the screw fell off
7. I checked it on 17th around 930 am and called in FO for wifi access, I was promised a callback from IT which never happened until 18th morning where I called up IT directly

Now,

On 17th morning around 1030 I raised concern on their facebook page from point 2 to 6 but no one got back to me. One 18th afternoon I had to speak to FO in person and thats when they offered me to change my room (upgrade was not possible as I was already in their one of the best rooms) I refused the change cause shifting all stuffs from one room to their other is a headache.
Btw, the bathroom dustbin still remains the same, and I am sure that could have been changed or replaced but no one bothered.

ps: maintenance person came and fixed the door handle

ps: HK opens your room and does the cleaning even if you do not tag your door as make my room.

ps. HK broke the towel hanger in the bathroom

In short the journey I started in 2016, stops with thia trip now. I shall never return to IndiSmart again.

Good thing was that BF spread was good and had multiple options.

Bad things, late back attitude of service personnels. On 18th morning , no one even came forward to serve a glass of water to me on BF.
FO is the most lousy dept in the hotels, few chitchatter are hired who is more concerned with chit chat than customer service.

My check out was on 19th Feb, but I got a call from FO on 18th asking when shall I check out as it is already 12pm. This proofs lack of internal communication and no ground work done before contacting a customer.
I requested for a late check out which was already approved but effective 10am on 19th multiple people from FO started calling me to check when I am checking out and who approved late check out and staying beyond 12pm might call for half day rent.
ownerResponse/text:

title: Sameeksha By Sachin - Location Is The Biggest Advantage For Business Travelers
text:
I stayed at IndiSmart Hotel Kolkata during my official trip for 2 nights, I checked in on 2nd Feb 18 and checked out on 4th Feb 18. I stayed at 6th Floor. Rooms are not very spacious though neat and clean but space was sufficient for one guest. Bathroom is also very congested. View from Hotel Room was OK, one can not expect great view as office buildings are around and can be seen from the hotel. There is no swimming pool in the hotel. Room Service and restaurant services both were just average.They were taking time to serve at the room though the staff was courteous. Breakfast menu and dinner menu was limited and average in taste. Good part was that they provided me packed breakfast on my request. Housekeeping was just OK. WiFi facility was available and working properly. The biggest advantage of the hotel is the proximity with offices, malls, cinema and outside restaurants.

Overall I would say that this hotel is average hotel, OK for business travelers and that too for short stay.

title: Nice Budget Hotel w
text:
Location:

Hotel is ideally located at the heart of Salt lake city surrounded with big MNC's / corporates and government offices.

Ambience:

Hotel has a nice / decent ambience. The rooms are spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The furniture / towels are clean and tidy. Washroom is well maintained and quite tidy. Room has 32" LCD, fridge, AC and table / sofa.

Service:

Room service is slow. Food quantity served is quite less compared to the price one pays. Hence I would not recommend you to opt for their room service, rather go out you will find many good  and better options for eating.

Buffet Breakfast:

Buffet breakfast is just fine, its not very lavish but good enough to kick start your day. Though the place where the buffet is offered is not too big so at times you may struggle to find seating space. The offer from Paranthas to South Indian stuff like Idlis / Dosa. Omelette is available on request. As far as non-veg item is concerned they will only have single dish to chose from. Few bakery items like muffins, cakes would be available along with fresh fruits (2-3 varieties). For omelette you may have to wait for 20-30 mins hence it is recommended to order the moment you enter the restaurant for breakfast.

Staff:

Staff is warm and friendly. Check-in process was quick and efficient.

Negative:

Speed of wi-fi is not upto the mark. Hence at times you struggle to work. Room service / quality / quantity of food is not upto the mark. The have a small gym but I hardly found it operating.

title: If your existing rooms are badly maintained, renovated rooms would degenerate fast too !
text:
Pros: 1. The hotel is close to the airport, <3 km. 2. Its on the main road. 3. It has a bar & restaurant which operates till 11:30 Night. 4. Early morning flt - you can grab a sandwich, cookies, tea/coffie at reception from 04:30hrs. 
Cons: 1. existing rooms obviously have not been well maintained. Upper floor rooms have been renovated but if the standard of O&M remains the same as it is today then even the renovated rooms will meet the same fate as the old ones - bad. I was first given a room which had the AC power pin with bare studs pins ready to kill an unaware customer; the water plumbing in toilet was choked which resulted in low pressure.
2. Vis -a-vis rooms size, decore and facilities its slightly high priced. 
3. Its under renovation.

To the credit of the management they did change my room from the second floor to the 4th floor to a better room - after 1.5 hrs.

If you have to stay close to the airport this could be ok choice. Not great.

title: just ok, not good enough for what u pay!
text: Stayed here due to marriage function at nearby hotel and due to airport proximity but not at all value for money hotel!! rooms are cramp, very small and you cant even keep the luggage properly forget about rest of the things. Service is extremely pathatic, had to call numerous times to get the room service done. bathrooms are ill designed and you will not feel comfort. i would really paid 1/3 of what they charged in other hotel and got the better of each and everything.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Comfortable for one night
text: For this type of hotel, i was comfortable... I wasnt planning on staying there but i was in a taxi and saw the clear sign and thought i would try it for my stop over... The reception staff were friendly and helpful. I had a single room which actually had a double bed.. The room was clean and the bathroom had everything i needed and really hot water which was a nice suprise.. I received  a plate of complimentary biscuits which were welcome.  There were plenty of good chanels on the tv to choose from... I ordered room service for dinner, the food was good and the service also... The kettle didnt work and house keeping replaced it straight away..there was some traffic noise from the busy road outside, but it was bearable. Breakfast was served in the coffee shop on the 1st floor.. Good hotel for a quick stop over.. Close to the airport.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Had a fine stay
text:
Stayed here few weeks back on a business trip to kolkata. Close to airport (6-7 kms), rooms were fine, service was ok, so was the food. outside the main Kolkata city.

Stay if you want to stay close to airport. Fine for a short duration.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Average !
text:

placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Good location average facility
text: Hotel is a great location if you have to be near airport - takes just about 5 minutes to reach. The facilities were not really up to mark. The room I was offered (503) was very small and not very bright in terms of lights and decor. The washroom too very small with some of things not working well. Food that I tried was ok but slightly overpriced for the class of hotel.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Clueless, completely out of depth, highway robbery
text:
I had a flight into Kolkata past 11 p.m. and had to catch a train from Howrah very early the next morning. So it made sense to check into what I hoped was a function B&B kind of hotel either very to the airport or the station.  That's how I discovered O2 on the website.  

Knowing I'd be very tired on arrival, I arranged for an airport pick up.  This is where the horror story begins.  On finding no one waiting at the exit, I called the handset of the driver who was supposed to pick me up - no response. I tried a couple of times again before he picked up and denied that he was on duty to pick me up. I then called hotel switchboard. It took them a couple of  minutes to figure out that I actually had a reservation.  

As is customary, the mobile signal in India kept dropping frequently.  I was constantly transferred between O2 Oxygen hotel and O2 VIP hotel (I found out later they were adjacent) before someone finally admitted that a mistake had been made and a driver will pick me up shortly.   Lo and behold ! The same driver who denied my pick up came to finally get me after an incredible 40 mins PAST my exit from the airport.  

For this ROYAL service, the hotel charged me INR 350 and refused to refund it !!!!

On the way to the hotel, I was informed by the driver (incidentally a rickety old smashed up vehicle in which the AC barely worked !!!!) that both hotels had just one car between them and that such experiences are fairly common and delays are always expected. 

I asked if the hotel bar/dining room might be open since I was hungry.  He said doubtful at the O2 Oxygen hotel, maybe at the O2 VIP.  The one at O2 Oxygen closes at midnight and thanks to the delays, I obviously missed it. 

The check in staff was profusely apologetic. However, would not entertain thoughts of any refund nor would volunteer to have food arranged from adjacent O2 VIP hotel if that hotel's dining was still open.

The sight of the room was astounding .... a visibly very old long handle broom and a smelly piece of rag was parked right next to the entrance door of the room.  The Wi-Fi internet did not work, the sofa gave me shudders..there were black stain marks from spilt water or whatever all over it.  The bathroom smelt overpoweringly of phenyl, hair was all over the floor.  

When the AC started, it roared.  The plastic casing of the AC was glued onto the frame via tapes.  Pillows were as thin as towels and the bedsheet looked as if someone slept in it before I moved in. 

Thank God my misery was over in 5 hours.  These bums charged me INR 4,100 (US$70approx.) for these marvelous courtesies. 

Never ever again.  

Anywhere else in the world, you can happily sue these guys and make a fortune.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Not worth the money they are charging
text:
The room which they gave us was not covered by lift. Very bad smell was coming out, the smell of a closed space, was coming out. A boy brought some room  spray to sprinkle, but it was not sufficient. The toilet flush was not working and we had to pour down water by buckets. All the fittings of bathroom were quite loose. It was a disgusting experience and the room was definitely not worth the money they charged.  
  Please take care for all these things.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Regarding Support Staff

It is customers wish whether to give a tip or not.

title: Average Hotel with a Great Location
text:
I have stayed in this Hotel during the Biggest Festival in Kolkata @ Durga Puja. I have booked this hotel from one of the online website. I have even gone through feedback online before booking it. Once i reached the Airport i took an Uber to the Hotel. I would have given up driving , but the Uber Driver Mr. Prashant had great patience to drive us through the narrow lanes of New Market which is totally filled by Pedestrian. It was chock a Block. I really thanked this guy for taking so much pain to drop us at the door of the hotel. Its in a small lane bang opp to New Market. Location Good everything nearby. Taxi to Metro and in the midst of shopping place. 
Very Small reception, Staff was courteous. Based on my booking they allotted me a room. After seeing the room i was shocked, the room was so small that 2 people cannot move at the same time. There was almost no space after the bed to move . So when i complained then i was given an option of upgrading it to a better spacious room with a price. I agreed as i didnt had any choice rather than to pay extra. 
I would really appreciate the bell  boy staff ( forgot his name) he recommended a room newly renovated for me to the Front Office staff. The room was better. 
Breakfast was good with good choice
Room Service and Housekeeping Staff is good. 

Need to improve the room size and also the looks of the older rooms.

title: Great for a budget stay
text: We stayed in this hotel from 4th Nov to 8th Nov. The hotel staff welcomed us with welcome drink and took care of our bags. The first impression was quite good. The rooms were great. The bathrooms were also spacious and decent. I was really impressed by the service, for instance, they provide us with newspapers and 4 water bottles every day per room, etc. The staff was helpful. The buffet breakfast had a variety of different items and was delicious. The building has quite a vintage look. The rooftop restaurant is quite famous in the area and has a great ambience. The hotel is located in the New Market Area which is nearby from most tourist attractions and also is nearby a Esplanade metro station and a tram station. Best budget option for tourists who are willing to explore the vintage side of Kolkata.

Any request we made to reception staff, was promptly taken care of, and we would be happy to stay here again.

title: Great location and experience in Kolkata
text:
We stayed at the Lindsay for 5 nights while attending a friend's wedding in Kolkata. I think the best thing about the hotel is the location, as it made for easy sightseeing in the city centre and was also easy to get back as we could simply catch a cab and ask for New Market. 

We found the staff to be very polite and friendly, and the room to be perfectly clean. The room was cleaned everyday and we were given 4 fresh water bottles each day which we could keep icy cold in the fridge in the room. 

The breakfast is mainly Indian food, as the guests themselves are mainly Indian! Although for foreign travellers there is also standard cereals toast and eggs available. 

Overall we found no fault with the Lindsay and would happily stay here again. We stayed on the 8th floor and found it nice and quiet.

text: I have to travel to Bangalore and need to reach early morning to attend a meeting. I have booked a room in this hotel and also take a airport pickup. title: nice for transit passenger
text: i checked in the hotel at 7.00am(although check in time is 12noon).Mr Saikot Chakraborty Manager-Business Development O2 Hotels Kolkata Mobile : 9674122210 himself did my reservation in super deluxe room in cp plan at a tariff of Rs3500/ +taxes.Got a nice & clean room without any hassle.since i was too tired from last 20hrs travelling they arranged my complimentary breakfast in my room,the bf was very tasty &filling and more than enough for me.i took a nice shower although i miss the toiletries as compared to other 3-5 stars hotel.after bf i hit the comfortable,quite bed  for a long deep sleep.wake up in noon.took the lunch,asked for ironing my attires.went outside for enjoying the evening,the hotel arrange a  innova with a nice driver(honest,sincere a&soft spoken-he make sure that i dont spend a single rupee extra-i must admit its a very rare quality for driver-although he doesnot know that i know each & every corner of kolkatta,stayed there for almost 2 yrs.).i checked out around 3.30 in the mrng,only took 4min to reach the airport.very nice for transit.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Bad qualiry
text: We had booked in O2 oxygen & went there but the staff said the rooms are full & our room is blocked in O2 VIP another property of them. The VIP hotel is 2 buildings away. They did not bother to assist in helping us take the luggage there. We had to carry & find VIP hotel was much less inferior in quality to oxygen. Rooms were not clean.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: So So
text:
The hotel's biggest advantage is its proximity to the airport. The facilities are good and the staff, very courteous and helpful.

However, rooms are quite small considering the high tariff. 

Good for transit stay
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Good location but average service
text: I booked this hotel for a single night stop-over in Kolkatta for a client meeting. It is very conveniently located near the airport. I was not however, thrilled by the service. It was not bad, but nothing extraordinary. The room was spacy and relatively clean. One of the issues was my room key was not working, and they could not fix it. So, to enter my room I had to wait for the person with the Master key to come in and open it. This could have been very annoying if I had stayed longer. The most absurd thing was their hotel policy. I went with my colleague to the upper floor restaurant, but was told we need to go to the ground floor as the upper floor restaurant was-"Only for families". To put things in perspective, this was the middle of a saturday afternoon and we were preparing for a business meeting, so we found the attitude baffling. The ground floor restaurant had a better ambience than the upper floor. For the price, the hotel gave decent service, but is strictly average. Oh, and the hot water was not working in the bathroom.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Dece but no WiFi.
text: Room was quite nice but WiFi was unusable. Slowest I've seen in India. 1 in 25 pages would load. I was sick so couldn't really leave the hotel. Bathroom was nice. Cable TV had lots of channels. Service was meh. Was asked if I was staying at the hotel by staff members if I walked to my room. Bought ~150 rupees of stuff from the minibar. Took 4 staff members, 10 minutes, a printed invoice and a receipt to produce the bill. It's like no one had ever bought from the minibar before.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Good Hotel
text: Hotel is excellent for transit but it is expensive for that small room. However u will not find any good hotels near by airport. Don't book hotel by calling their no at all. Book from travel agents like cleartrip or makemytrip etc.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: bed and room floor very clean, but rest of room?
text:
This applies to the O2 Vip, other rooms may be different.

Bed, towels, floor are absolutely clean. THat is very important to me.
Distance/time from airport is excellent (10 mins).

In my room, you wouldn't want to touch the inroom menu. The walls have been painted 10 (?) years ago. I made sure not to touch them but have a cushion behind me when I leaned against the wall, sitting on the bed. Do I want to put my fresh clothes for tomorrow onto the easy chair? I am not sure. Door, table, night table, cupboard,   hm...? I don't need 4 star hotels, but this was the most worn down of the budget hotels I visited in India
Except for the menu, all this is not really dirty (well, the walls are not clean or freshly remade), but very worn out.
Just like a run down version of a ginger.

In addition to typical road noice which I found acceptable in a room to the side of the hotel, there is a mosque very nearby calling out several times a day and at 5 am on the Monday I stayed here.

I think it is perfectly ok for night in, morning out, espeially due to its perfect distance to airport. Unfortunately, I arrived at 2pm  and felt this is not a good place for me to stay half a day waiting for my business partner.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Decent Hotel close to Kolkata Airport
text:
Its a decent hotel in the vicinity of Kolkata Airport. Hotel is clean and staff is cooperative. Rooms in the front side of the hotel remain noisy through out the night as the hotel is on the highway. Food is good. There's a disco in the basement and entry is complimentary for the guests. Rooms are reasonably good. Hotel is a bit costlier may be due to the proximity to the airport. Airport pick-up and drop is provided by the hotel but its costlier. Finding a Cab is not difficult at any time as its a highway. 

All in all, hotel is decent.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: MOST DISGUSTING HOTEL.
text: If you want to spend to be treated rudely by ill-mannered and arrogant staff, then this is just the hotel. Despite its close location to the airport, the hotel seriously lacks trained staff who are extremely rude. I would NEVER want anybody to stay in such a disgusting hotel.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: 18hrs stay at O2
text:
We checked in early morning on 21st feb n really appreciate staff of this hotel, staff was very courteous n helpful. Room was also neat n clean with all require amenities. Just 3km from airport, the best part of this hotel was their restra. Food was awesome n price were normal.
We loved our stay:)
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: A good option near Kolkata's airport
text:
We booked at o2 hotel after scouring TripAdvisor reviews and determining that the hotel was the best mediocre option out of all the mediocre options.  It turned out to be a pretty good stay, and we would certainly stay there again if in the same position with flights.  Arriving a midnight and departing at 10:30AM, the hotel gave us a great rest, two complimentary water bottles (much appreciated), and a very delicious mainly South-Indian style breakfast (much, much appreciated). 

The cost is steep (though you're of course paying for convenience and location), and, at 350Rs, the hotel's airport pick-up service is quite a bit more expensive than the pre-paid taxi service (for 110Rs).  The whole place feels a bit musty and cigarettey, but on the whole, this is totally manageable, and we are very glad we stayed and very thankful to the staff who stayed up to greet us.  Thanks!
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Comfortable Stay at hotel "O2"
text:
Well, to start with, if you are on a business/personal trip to Kolkata and if you wish you to stay close to Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, then Hotel "O2" is a good choice. 
The rooms are neat and also the staff is cordial. I visited this hotel just two weeks before. I reached Kolkata from Delhi at 23:45 Hrs. I had to catch a flight to Guwahati, next morning at 9:00 Hrs. So I decided to stay in this hotel for a night. It's very near to the airport (About 1.5 km). However, the hotel is a bit costly. The hotel has got a good restaurant. My overall experience at this hotel is satisfactory & I had a comforatble stay.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: nice hotel
text: it is a nice hotel and i had been there some time back. the best part it is close to the airport around 2 kms from it. the food was good and nice ambience.  there is an open air restaurant at the terrace as well
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Average
text:
I stayed in this hotel for only 6 hours as this is very near to the airport so you have no other choice. The room is very small. The food was not so good, the fish which I ordered frm the restaurant was not fresh at all. 

This hotel is good for staying for very short time and is very costly according to its standard.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: returning visit
text:
this hotel is near the airport.
you pay Rs110/ to the police controlled prepaid taxi and you are safe from the hasseles/ fighting with the taxiwalas., ( as a person from chennai, i am afraid of Taxis)- you reach Hotel within 10 min.

the hotel is reasonably clean and has all the requirements of a decent business hotel.
food is good. 
but you should not expect any thing more.
the top staff are good, but the next stage staff are not trained and are a bit arrogant in handling the guests.
other wise , I love to stay there, and use the benefits
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Transit Hotel at Kolkata
text: Hotel O2 VIP is the best option available for transit stay at Kolkata while traveling by air. Very near to airport and offering pickup and drop facility any time. You save lot of time to and fro from airport to Hotel.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Excellent for an overnight stay
text: I used this hotel for an overnight stay, enroute Mumbai to Jamshedpur. It is very close to the airport, which makes it convenient for business travelers who need to board a train the next morning for smaller towns in eastern India. The rooms are well-appointed, and one feels cosy. The room service is strictly OK, given the high price. The biggest advantage is that plenty of taxis are available right in front of the hotel, even at odd hours such as 3 am.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Simply Superb
text: After searching 5 hotels at midnight in the new market area of Kolkata this is the best hotel considering the location and money. Every staff was wonderful from reception to bell boy to restaurant staffs to security guard. Breakfast was also pretty good which includes 4 types of juices. Room ambience was very nice. There's a fan in the toilet for summer times which is the first I've ever seen. My 3 year old kid enjoyed a lot cause room was specious (executive room). Rooftop restaurant was also good. Very good views. I could've given 4 star but comparing 5 hotels near new market this hotel is worth 5 star.

title: Some good. Some can be improved.
text:
Stayed there for 4 nights in Feb 2018.

Pros-
1. Outstanding, brilliant location. 
2. Very good complementary breakfast. 
3. Room is good with comfy bed. You have both AC and fan, basic complementary toiletries, clean floors, clean towels. 
4. Availability of hot water all the time. 

Cons- 
1. Extremely poor wifi. I had this feedback before booking and it came True. 
2. Except few (for example, Mr. Saikot, very well mannered) most of the staffs were not courteous. You will have a feeling that, by having a room there, they are actually doing a favor to you. Talking always in a 007 tone with no smile. 
3. Very light color/brown 2 layer curtains which easily allows the daylight to get in and eventually hampers sleeping. 

I still recommend this hotel for any visitor to stay as the cons I mentioned can be improved. I am also looking forward to stay again in this hotel in my next visits.

title: Nice Hotel at he Best Location
text:
The location is very good, just on the iconic New Market. Park street where some of the city's best bars and restaurants are located is just 5 minutes walk. Clean property, reasonable service. The noise level at the room s pretty high though. The breakfast is good if you like Indian food; otherwise the choices are limited. Cost wise it might appear little price but if the savings on taxi fare is considered it is reasonable. Overall it's a good place to stay for couple of days, particularly if you are in Kolkata for shopping and the street food.
The roof top bar is also good; though we ordered for something and got another dish.

If we had stayed in one of the cavernous lodges in Sudder Street, then these would not have been a concern. But The Lindsay presents itself as a star hotel, and yet it gives nothing to its customers. title: Mediocre - not worth the $$ but provided all the necessary things
text: The hotel was pricey for what we got. There were homeless people always sleeping outside the hotel and piles of trash/dirt right outside the door. I would expect them to keep their surrounding space clean, at least by the door. The hallways were dusty from not vacuuming and we develeoped severe dust allergies while in Kolkata so this did not help. Overall, the hotel provided all the necessary accommodations (nice rooms, restroom, daily cleaning, etc). The breakfast was terrible and lobby staff inattentive and not pro-active at all.. everyone seemed to be in a daze, not in a hurry to get anything done. I don't think it was worth the $70-$80 per night I paid.

title: Better than many hotels in Kolkata
text: I stayed with my family in the hotel for 8 nights. We booked two rooms. First seven nights we got our expected rooms in the higher floor - bright, full of day lights. However, we didn't get the similar room when we came back from a two day trip. The rooms were already paid but the relevant staffs didn't book our rooms properly. I felt they were unprofessional. Most of the staffs including the desk staffs were really good, especially Mr. Deepak. They were attentive to our issues and took quick steps. I felt that the hotel need to improve in the quality assurance and top level monitoring. I have found dust and dirt in the rooms even after regular cleaning. When I took it to their notification they immediately cleaned it. They have system but not well monitored.  The cleaning staffs need to learn the value of cleanliness. The rooms have good toilet amenities, fresh towels every day, flow of hot and cold water, enough drinking water. Security is also good. Breakfast is good but become monotonous after couple of days as the items are almost same every day. They need to offer live egg corner and few more items alternative days to bring diversity. The rooms in the higher floor are better in terms of fresh air and natural lights. I liked the room 601. It has big window and good view of Hogg Market and beyond. They have good wifi connection and each room gets three device connection. The hotel management can think to put a travel desk which would be really helpful for the guests.

title: Great hotel right in the centre of the action!
text:
Stayed at The Lindsay twice this trip and was impressed by this mid-range hotel.  Bed linen was new and clean.  I always travel with a sleeping bag liner in India and there was no need to use it at this hotel.  The mattresses were comfortable.  If you haven't stayed in Kolkata before, it's a busy, noisy city and very hard to get away from the constant noise, so don't expect peace and quiet anywhere except for a few hours between 11pm and 4am.
On my second visit there was a housekeeping issue in the bathroom and it was remedied immediately.  I did request that the shower drain be cleared (snaked), but pretty sure that did not happen.  Find this is a common problem in India.
Both reception staff and front door staff were extremely helpful in printing something for me, accommodating a room request, storing bags, dealing with cabs and beggars.
Breakfast is included and the buffet is quite extensive including both Indian and western flavours.

title: Cheaters
text: Located in the heart of the city, the hotel decided to charge me 50% extra of my total bill once I arrived with my family at check-in to take advantage of the fact that there were sold-outs all across the city. They had no such policy and instead listed it as extra beds, even though we didn't use more than one extra bed. They are cheaters to say the least. If you want an authentic Bengali experience of being cheated in New Market Area, then feel free to come here. However, if you want a comfortable and fair stay, don't come here. The shopping downstairs on the street is a really cool experienced nonetheless.

It was a pleasure having you staying with us. We had gone through your review and found it was incorrect. title: In centro
text:

Le camere sono molto diverse: alcune sono carine e abbastanza pulite (316), altre sono vecchie e piuttosto sporche (408) oppure non hanno la finestra. Controllate all'assegnazione ed eventualmente provate a fare un cambio!!!
Colazione ok. 
Sulla terrazza un bel ristorante con una splendida vista: cibo buono ma servizio lento e confuso!

text:

The rooftop restaurant offers great views of the city and has great food and drinks.

I am from Canada, and even by Canadian standards this is a clean and well rum hotel.

title: Good budget hotel
text:
The hotel is always open, I was traveling and arrived Kolkata at midnight and they gave me the hotel room. Rooms are good and well furnished with all the essentials and toiletries. And the first hotel which gave 4 bottles as complimentary. 

Hotel offers buffet breakfast which is very good. And they do have variety of options to choose from. Options on juices, fruits and tea/coffee also available. The entrance is small and people might get wrong impression but the hotel is good to stay. Another added advantage is that it is closer to Howarh station and located in New Market area itself. Those who are traveling to Kolkata for marketing, then this is best hotel as many eateries and market are nearby. 
The only problem I found was the cigarette smoke coming fire exit. People were smoking.

title: Great staff
text:
The best part of this hotel was the staff, who were extremely helpful and courteous. The location is a bit of a mixed bag though. First off, it's located right in the center of the city, making it easy to go anywhere. On the opposite side is the fact that it's right in the middle of New Market area, which means it's heavily crowded at all times of day and cars can't stop for long here.

Other than that, we didn't like the room we got. It was located right at the end of the floor, had a worn down look, the shower head was not properly fitted, and it was very small. Plus, there was no proper window in the room. For the price we paid, I was expecting much better.

For the room, I'd rate this 1 or 2 stars. But the staff's behavior adds one more star.

title: Close.... but no Cigar
text:
‘The Lindsay’ hotel located in Lindsay Street, directly opposite the SS Hogg Market is pitching itself at the higher end of the market.
The Indians do a spectacularly good job of creating ‘high end’ luxury hotels, ‘The Lindsay’ is not in that league, it seems to hover somewhere around upper ‘mid range’. 

Check in is an efficient but lengthy process.
Downstairs dinning room is well run.
My room was just okay but looking tired and had previously been occupied by smokers (I found this a problem). The staff did his best to clear the smell without success. It is NOT a fault of the hotels staff. It IS a problem with hotel policy.

A/C – WiFi – TV – Fridge all work well.
The building is safe and secure.
Elevators x2 reach all floors.
The rooftop restaurant looks good.

A bit of a ‘make over’ and a ‘no smoking’ policy would make this hotel a viable alternative, currently, there is better value to be had in the neighbourhood. 

My experience at ‘The Lindsay’ is that of one person on one night – please check other guests reviews.

title: Short stay for shopping
text:
For someone who loves victorian architecture and heritage Kolkata is the place to be. 3 things I love about Kolkata is the architecture, street food and shop till you drop! The Lindsay is nestled in the chaotic yet vibrant New Market area. For people who love to shop and enjoy the amazing street food The Lindsay is a great place to anchor. Once you step out of the Hotel, you have the New Market and underground Simpark A/C market right opposite to the hotel and turn left to walk towards the Muslim street if u fancy halal food and Panjabi ladies wear at bargain prices. walk further down the lane you'll reach the main road and on your right will be the Grand Oberoi Hotel and small renovated boutique hotels like The Corner Courtyard where you can enjoy some quite leisure time. 

The room we stayed in was quite spacious for an extra bed to be fitted since we were 3. The Hotel offers a free breakfast with the rooms. The breakfast layout is small yet modest and offers both veg and non-veg and has a touch of english breakfast too. There is round the clock room service, although the daily "Make my room" service needs improvement. We left the hotel right after breakfast and asked them to clean our room, but everyday when we came back we had to call housekeeping for toiletries and toilet paper that was finished and not replenished during the cleaning service. Another problem we faced was the hotel only provides 1 key card for the room. We were three people and all going in different directions, so we had to leave the key card at the reception in case any of us came back before the others and needed access to the room. 

Having said all that, the biggest plus point is that the hotel lobby is a safe place to leave your shopping or schedule deliveries to. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The hotel also offers spa services in-rooms and on the 9th floor. however there is only 1 male masseuse for all guests and it opens from 6:30am till 8:30pm. Overall it was a comfortable and satisfying stay at The Lindsay.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from The Lindsay Kolkata!!!!

Have a nice day.

The Lindsay

title: Piece of peace midst chaos of dharmatala
text:
Stayed alone at The Lindsay for 2 days in March 2017.
Good: perfect location, bang opposite New Market, walking distance from the Museum (Jadughar), near Victoria, less than Rs. 250 in yellow cab (prepaid) from airport, easy to navigate to places like Gariahat (the main market) etc. good decor, beautifully decorated corridors with photographs of bygone Calcutta days, places, actors etc. Beautiful rooftop open restaurant with good beer, ok food & amazing views. Room was comfortable (adequate toiletries, 4 bottles of water) however a bit small.
Not so good: bathing room needs new fittings. Reception at first floor (not a problem for me)

title: Aftab uz Zaman
text:
Probably one of the nastiest, dirty, unhygienic hotels I have ever encountered. Although I booked my stay for 5 nights but eventually left it right after staying 1 night. Didn't even bother to ask for refund. If anybody is planning to get really sick/ill, please feel free to stay. 
Trust me they are nowhere near to what to depicted in the internet pics. They shouldn't be classified as 3 stars. Rather they should be classified as guest house for chauffeurs. Filthiest place to stay. Me and my family got completely sick.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Aftabuzzaman,

Greetings from The Lindsay Kolkata !!!

At the outset, we would like to Thank You for choosing to stay at our Hotel. 

Your Booking was for 5 Nights, but you checked out at the next day. 
During the Check out our Front Office Executive inquired the reason for your unscheduled departure & you said that there was an emergency so you have to leave immediately.  
At no point of time did you complain about our Hotel. 
You had also requested for refund, but was informed accordingly that since the booking was from Agoda.com, you should getting in touch with the Agoda.com for the refund.

text:

We booked 2 rooms for 3 nights. Rooms were very small and unclean. Bathroom was stinking. Towels were dirty and smelly. Food was ok but very very expensive. Staff members were supportive. 

Room tariff is too high equivalent to some 4 star property but there is nothing like 4 star in this hotel. They should charge half of what they are charging currently for the services they providing.

title: Total Rip Off ( O2 VIP)
text: This is my second review on this property. In my previous visit I had stayed in their old building and it was OK. Since I was not really satisfied, this time around I made the reservation in the new property which was supposed to be "better". But it turned out to be a mistake.The prices for all rooms have gone up by more than Rs.500 for nothing. The rooms are smaller than the old building. The pics posted on their site are tricked(refer my pic).Moreover, my room was stinking when i walked in and the sheets were damp too. After i complained the receptionist, a room boy was sent with a freshener and that's how they took care of the smell. The bathroom was stinking too and I had to keep the exhaust on the whole time. Noone would expect these things when you pay Rs.4200 for room. For this kind of price you deserve a lot more. They should visit the Ginger Hotels in a small city like Agartala where you get one of the cleanest & spacious rooms for Rs.1500( it was a special offer price when I visited). Even in a tourist place like Goa, I had a fantastic room at the Park for almost similar price ( Rs.4600 in 2012). The only saving grace was the food which was good. Avoid.

title: My experience
text: I booked this hotel from Austin, Texas for a short term stay. Although I live in USA, I am fully aware of the conditions in India. My experience in staying here for three nights is as follows: (1) the hotel has an excellent clean area for breakfast at the the top roof level. The breakfast is delicious with Indian menu (2) The staff at the hotel are well-mannered and helpful and I may add a special mention of Bubai Biswas at the front desk (3) The hotel is moderately priced and is worth the money (4) The location of the hotel is such that the hotel has no say in controlling the surroundings and the surrounding is not pretty (5) The hotel management is trying its best to renovate and build some structures to have a better appearance for entrance and I see some construction at the front entrance to beautify the entrance by concreting the surface and making it look nice.(6)The food quality and quantity are good (7) The bedding and pillows need to improve in the cushioning quality and the windows need to be large (8) The room is spacious including the bath room (9) More control needs to be exercised on 'smoking' in restaurant and aisle.

title: Very Good for Transit
text:
The problem travelling to Dhaka from Bangalore is that there are few choices. I have more often done the Delhi route - only because there are no convenient flights from Kolkata during the day (at least not on the airlines I use most). This time I had no choice but to stay overnight in Kolkata because of commitments at home and the need to be in Dhaka by 10am on the next day.
Found O2 on the net and the proximity to the airport was what caught the attention.
No regrets - Sambu picked us up from the airport and we were at the hotel in 10 minutes. There are two O2s - we stayed at the O2 VIP. Check in was easy and check out equally rapid.
The room is decent - looked a little dingy in the night conditions but comfortable all the same. Taking the stairs from and to the room can out you off - because the stairway does seem a little tight and dirty. 
They have a coffee shop (groundfloor), a restaurant (first floor) and a loud (on a Saturday night)disco in the basement. We had some Indian bread and chicken (kurchan) for dinner - really delicious.
If you are a light sleeper the occasional honk from the road may be disturbing but if the objective is to wake up early and get to the airport by 5am then it actually helps!
Bottom line - definitely recommended for transits.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: Strictly average
text:
This review is about the old O2 hotel, which is one building away from the new O2 hotel. I was attending a friend's wedding in Kolkata and the venue happened to be close to this hotel and the airport. Hence i was put up here. I stayed for just one night and in that sense it does the job. The food was not great and the service was not great in the restaurant. Me and my friend had to wait for almost 45 mins to get 2 starters inspite of being the only customers there!
The buffet breakfast on offer was ordinary. If you are looking for a place to just dump your luggage and go around, just to come back to sleep, then this hotel is a good bet. There is a big Haldiram's shop 5 minutes away from the hotel which can be checked out.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: For transit only
text: O2 is budget hotel meant for people in transit through Calcutta airport. It is located close to the  airport and offers a decent stay. The food here is average and the staff decent. The new building has better rooms compared to the old one.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: O2 Oxygen, Kolkata :: One of the Best Transit Hotels Near the Airport
text: This is by far the best transit hotel that I had ever come across in Kolkata. Just 15 - 20 minutes drive from the Airport and you are greeted by a very wonderful person in the form of Rajat. This was my second visit to this hotel, and it cannot get any better when you find a smiling and welcoming face at the Front Office at 2300 + hours.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: It's OK
text: I stayed twice in this hotel. The staff is not good. However, amenities is good per cost. Food is excellent. Better to avoid in case you have good option available. Good if want to stay near Air Port in Kolkata.
placeInfo/address: VIP Road Ramkrishna Pally, Kaikhali, Kolkata (Calcutta) 700052 India

title: its acceptable
text: I like O2 Restaurants food specialy their Venezia Speciality Restaurant food.situated in O2 Vip Hotel. Rooms are well decorated, neat & clean they have 24 hrs. coffee shop with round the clock service
